name: Southern-Style Baked Banana Pudding
comments: ['          Chilled pudding and folded whipped heavy whipping cream to cool pudding then finished receipe as written.  Best Banana pudding ever. ', '           I used evaporated milk instead of whole milk, my husband said it was absolutely delicious. ', '          Delicious, perfect spring dish , just made 1 little  change, instead of vanilla wafers, I added hazelnut wafers. name: Overnight Chia Oats
comments: ['          Delicious treat I added a few drops of vanilla extract an a pinch of salt to take it up a knotch....yummy! ', '          This Overnight Breakfast Idea that make for a Bright Start to the Day is  wonderful, healthy, tasty easy, and can be modified.  I have made a similar recipe many times and like other reviews I prepared several at a time and kept them in the refrigerator for a quick and satisfying breakfast.  Also, for a change have switched the fruit or added either nuts or coconut instead of chia seeds, used regular milk instead of almond milk and garnished with toasted slivered almond or whatever I had on hand and always turned out just as good.  This recipe is very forgiving and fabulous! ', '          Yummy! I added more bananas.  Will try with coconut mil in future and use nuts too. ', '          Chocolate ', '          I found the quantity of milk was a little less than needed. Still stays chewy. Overall I liked the recipe but was a bit disappointed with the texture. It was a little better with a little more milk. ', '          I added strawberries and blueberries as well ', '          Was so easy and quick   next day ', '          I make with any fruit I have on hand.  We like to heat the mixture from the jar to a bowl in the microwave for breakfast.  It is very nourishing and good. ', '          This is a great weekday breakfast. I make several at a time and keep them in the refrigerator for a quick and satisfying breakfast. I followed the recipe exactly, and they turned out great. The only modification was that I added 1/4 cup of raisins to each jar. This is a game changer. The raisins rehydrate and become plump and juicy, with a nice crispness to them, like when you bite into a fresh grape. Definitely one of my favorite new items to make. ']

name: Easy Banana Brownies
comments: ['          I baked these twice in the last 2 weeks. So good. I add baking powder so it s more like a cake.  Delicious, moist and perfect ! ', '          So delicious..I doubled the recipe and not sure where I went wrong as it came out crumbly!! The taste is phenomenal!! ', '          the first time I made it I followed the recipe exactly as written. it tasted more banana bread than brownie VERY light chocolate flavor 2-3 stars. I tried  the recipe again  but with a full cup of Chocolate Chips and a 1/4 C of cocoa powder and it was AMAMZING!!! ', '          The flavor of the brownies was tasty.  The texture was much drier than I expected.  I will try it again with a second egg. ', '          Love it!!!   Easy to make! ', '          Fudgy consistency, but tbh the banana made it a little weird. Would prefer a basic brownie I think. ', '          My 7yo son loved it. The directions were very easy even for someone who has not much experience in the kitchen like me. The first time I‚Äôve made it, I didn‚Äôt have proper baking materials so I used a disposable aluminum tray. The turn out was perfect. But the second time, I used an 8‚Äù loaf pan and baked it for 30 minutes for 325 degrees as instructed but it was undone in the middle. I baked for another 10 and came out fudgy but was still very good. ', '          I had 2 bananas to use up so I added a second egg as well. Baked in a glass 11X7" dish.  Increased baking time to 35 minutes. The result was fudgy and moist. Definitely will make again. ', '          Amazing! My kids loved them and they were soooo easy to make. Will definitely make again ']

name: Easy Banana Loaf Cake
comments: ['          The best and super easy ', "          I replace butter with vegetable oil and use brown sugar and add cinnamon.  It's good but next time I will try with butter. It's super easy I like it. ", '           So easy and effortless. ', "          Its the best ever tasted. No longer make banana bread anymore. Always make a diubke batch because it doesn't last very long. ", '          I added walnuts and chocolate chips ', '          Added chocolate chips and 2 extra bananas. ', '          Fantastic recipe, I adjusted the sugar to 1/3 instead of a cup. Super delicious and moist! ', '          I added 1/4 cup of coconut rum and 1/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips to this and it turned out delicious! ', '           It is a beautiful recipe. I added a streusel topping. I also added walnuts and made it sugar free substituting Stevia. ']

name: Cream Cheese Banana Bread
comments: ["          No changes and it was perfect! My whole family loved it. (Even the ones that don't eat sour cream loved it! ", '          I added a little orange zest to the cream cheese. Delicious! I can see tweaking the recipe for the seasons. Warm spices and nuts in the fall. Almond extract and almond butter in spring. Love the silky, Custard like texture of this bread . ', "          Meh.  Made recipe as printed except added cinnamon.  Not worth the trouble.  Cream cheese mixture was basically tasteless.  Will stick to my grandmother's banana nut bread recipe in the future. ", '          Was just ok for me. Wouldn‚Äôt make it again.  Looked better than it tasted.  I followed the recipe exactly as it was. ', '           I tweaked it,Used 2 1/2 bananas,1/2 tsp cinnamonAdded peanut butter chips to the bread and sprinkled on topAdded crushed mazap√°n Crunch bars to the bread and cream cheese‚Ä¶Used a good amount of butter to grease the glass loaf pan that I have..Baked at 350 for 1 Hr 3 Min (perfection!)Best banana bread ever. Ever!!! ', '          I have made this delicious bread twice now. The first time with the cream cheese and OMGoodness it was sooo good! The second time without the cream cheese, and still sooo delicious, moist and melts in your mouth like butter. The only change I made was that I added raisins. My husband loves the raisins in this bread. The whole family loves this recipe. ', '           The recipe was easy to follow after baking at 350 for 50 minutes we took out the bread and the top was very wet and raw dough looking. Baked longer...then longer and longer. After 90 mins the edges are very dark but the spots on top still look a little wet we think it might be okay now. ', '          The recipe worked great! Moist and delicious. One thing though. The cream cheese filling was runny so it cooked in a more swirl pattern rather than a "filling".  Mine didn\'t look like the photo. It is still a great recipe and I will make again. (I may have made the filling incorrectly :( ) ', "          I added nuts.. Can't wait to taste...Looks delicious üòã. "]

name: Kiwi Jam
comments: ["          Delicious, didn't have apples but it was kiwi soup.I added 3 gelatin packs and it didn't get betterFinally I added 3 corn starch slurries and it thickened as a jam is meant to! ", '           This jam has wonderful flavor with the pineapple juice.  It came out perfectly thick as a jam should so I did not have any issues with it being runny.  I used an immersion blender at the end of the cooking time to incorporate the cooked apple halves with skin into the jam and this definitely helped thicken it.  I then let it cook slightly longer partially covered.  This recipe made 6-8 oz/half pint jars of jam. ', "          This jam is Delicious!  When you finish boiling the jam, a taste test will seem too sweet.  It quickly mellows once the jam cools.  Using tart apples (Granny Smith or fall Macintosh) will also reduce the sweetness.  Very easy to make, simple to reduce/multiply recipe, & versatile - good on pancakes, cake, toast, & brie. Go make it!  You won't be sorry. ", '           I don‚Äôt eat kiwi but I made this for my boyfriend and it was phenomenal... it‚Äôs got me reconsidering my dislike for kiwi. We will definitely make this again ', "          My kids loved making this and the really love the sweet and tangy taste.  I must admit that you have let it boil and stir for a long time but it's worth it. ", "          This recipe is great if you interpret it correctly.  For every 3 cups of mashed kiwi you need to add 4 cups of sugar, 1/2 lemon, 3/4 pineapple juice and 3 apples ( I used nine apples for the whole batch, 2 lemons and just one serving of pinapple juice because I was worried it would be runny( but- it's a bit thick) .  Mine made 8 cups of kiwi (so that is how I calculated the recipe). I got three quart jars of jam.  It set up very nice, just like the picture. ", '          Delicious! 13 kiwis made just about 3 cups mashed. Added a little pineapple to make up the difference. Used an immersion blender before ladling into jars to blend the apple peels. Not too sweet, just right! I certainly hope to make this one again. ', "          I made kiwi jam and sent my dad who lives in the south a jar.  He called and said, honey, this looks like frogs eggs in pond scum.  Now, that's the name of my kiwi jam!  Love it!  MP in Chico. ", '          My jam came out perfect.  It was firm and held it\'s shape when I scooped it out of the jar and I didn\'t change anything except the temp and how long you cook it. Oh and be sure you use a really firm or tart apple like a Granny Smith, which has more natural pectin. The recipe says to lower heat and "simmer"... don\'t do this!  Heat it to a roiling boil and let it cook at that high temperature, stirring frequently until done... It was delicious! ']

name: Kiwi Banana Apple Smoothie
comments: ['           Creamy and delicious. Was concerned the apple would take away from the smoothness of the smoothie but with the Bananas, kiwi and plant milk this drink was on point. Refreshing and filling. Added a handful of spinach and a few dollops of homemade plain yogurt. Sliced and froze the banana and some of the plant milk (in silicone icecube tray) the night before making the smoothie. Great base recipe for a refreshing smoothie. ', "          It was great! I used more ice, however. One of my favorite smoothies for sure! I'll definitely make it again. ", '          if you don have maca powder i substituted it with cacao powder it was great ! :) ', "          I found it tasted better when you substituted a couple  cups  of strawberry's instead of kiwi's ", '          I hate kiwi but loved this. ', "           I sure liked this. Fresh and not too sweet. I used almond milk in place of cow's milk. The maca powder gives it a butterscotch sort of flavour, different and nice but being new to maca powder I only used 1/2 tsp and thought it was fine this way. Thank you Krissu for sharing this recipe. "]

name: PHILADELPHIA¬Æ Fruit Pizza
comments: ["          I've made this several times and with many different fruit combinations.  For me it's a no-fail recipe and always is so good.  My family, ranging from 9 to 72, all love it.  Thanks for the great recipe! ", '          Winter time is a challenge to find nice tasting fresh fruit.  I used canned mandarin oranges and canned pineapple,  cherry pie filling and fresh blueberries.  It all tastes great! ', '          I will make this again, it was very fresh! ', "           excited to post my photo of this recipe before even tasting it because it's so easy, and easy to make beautiful. I added almond extract instead of vanilla; I imagine orange extract and/or peel would also compliment these flavors.  Instead of water in the preserves, I used the light syrup drained from the mandarin oranges. ", "           excited to post my photo of this recipe before even tasting it because it's so easy, and easy to make beautiful. I added almond extract instead of vanilla; I imagine orange extract and/or peel would also compliment these flavors.  Instead of water in the preserves, I used the light syrup drained from the mandarin oranges. ", '          Wonderful and tasty.  Had this for guests and they all loved it!', '          This made a great impression! So easy. I debated rolling the dough out or cutting it into cookies and then laying it in the pizza pan. Cutting the cookies was the way to go. Easier to press the dough together and be sure it will cover the pan evenly. Also pack as much fruit as you can to make it pretty and fruity. I could‚Äôve put more fruit on it and it would‚Äôve looked a bit better. I only had a 14‚Äù pizza pan so I added another 4 oz of cream cheese a dash more sugar and vanilla. It looks like you slaved but it‚Äôs so easy! ', '          Pretty yummy. I added a splash of heavy cream (whipped cream would work) to the topping to lighten it up. ', '           Awesome!  Will definitley be making this again! ']

name: Fruit Pizza Even Better
comments: ['          We are not big fans of the almond flavor so used Lemon extract instead. Also left off the glaze. Perfect! ', '          I made this with gluten free flour and instead of cutting the butter in I melted it. ( was able to use 3/4 cup butter instead of 1cup). Also I found there was way too much glaze so could have cut it almost in half. I didn‚Äôt have pineapple juice so just used orange juice. This is a keeper. ', '          I made 1 & 1/2 the dough crust in order to fit across the whole stoneware rectangle pan.  Then I also doubled the cream cheese mixture to have enough to spread. ', "           The cookie portion needs more sugar as does the cream portion. It was an OK recipe but we'll be altering the recipe to taste more like a traditional fruit tart. The topping was a the best part and allowed the fruit to maintain color. ", '          My nephews  love it ', '           I make this every year.  shortcut..use pillsbury sugar cookie dough ', '          I used leftover cookie dough from my cut-out sugar cookies - worked great! ', "          Great recipe and easy to make! I didn't have kiwi so I substituted green grapes (cut in half). I used apple juice instead of pineapple juice. ", '           I used the sugar cookie dough crust, no glaze and everyone loved it!! ']

name: Fresh Fruit Tart with Mascarpone
comments: ['           This was the second time making this. It‚Äôs delicious! Easy! ', '          I‚Äôve made this numerous times and it‚Äôs always a favourite!!! I‚Äôve made this exact recipe and other times I‚Äôve substituted some ingredients.To make it lighter, I use plain Greek yogurt to replace the mascarpone. Also, I prefer to use brown sugar but I will only use half of the recommended amount. ', '           This recipe was great! I loved the crunch combined with the sweet fruit and tangy filling. I changed a couple things since i didn\'t have mascarpone or a tart pan. Instead of mascarpone i used a great lemon yogurt i had on hand, added about a tablespoon of lemon rind to boost the flavor of the yogurt, left out the spices and halved the amount of sugar. Since i didn\'t have a tart pan, i just used a 10" silicone cake pan, and that worked just fine. It was a huge hit at our family BBQ! ', '           I cut the filling sugar by half but this is one of my families favorite desserts. Kids request it as their ‚Äúbirthday cake‚Äù And it‚Äôs easy to make! Tastes best the next day. I usually don‚Äôt bother making a glaze since we eat it all in a couple days. ', '           Freakin‚Äô awesome! Didn‚Äôt use all the glaze, so next time will only make half ', '          I made this and turned out great. Very quick and easy to make. I already had mini tartlet pie shells. The only change is I added for the filling is I added less sugar, some fresh lemon juice, and omitted the the nutmeg. ', '          I made this and turned out great. Very quick and easy to make. I already had mini tartlet pie shells. The only change is I added for the filling is I added less sugar, some fresh lemon juice, and omitted the the nutmeg. ', '          Very delicious. Great recipe ', '          Holy guacamole(nice little food pun there) if this isnt the gosh darndest most delectable fruit tart I ever did make. I highly recommend ']

name: Poblano and Ground Pork Tacos
comments: ['          This was delicious! I cooked the onions separate just because my husband doesn‚Äôt like onions. So easy to make. I had all the ingredients on hand except for the poblano pepper and lime. I made these with lettuce, tomato, shredded cheddar cheese, and plain Greek yogurt. I forgot the cilantro, but will use it next time as I‚Äôm sure it makes them even better. I also used corn tortillas instead of flour because the flour tortillas bother my stomach. ', '          Made these this past weekend.  Yummy.  We ate them all weekend. ', "          It came out perfect everytime. Both my wife who doesn't like cilantro and my daughter who won't eat uncooked onions loved the salsa. Amazing! ", "          This is a keeper!  I made the tacos as the recipe directed and they were excellent. We are big fans of tacos al pastor and I wasn't sure we'd like these ground pork tacos as much ; yet we really enjoyed them.  They are just different enought and hold their own with a variety of accompaniments. I didn't have kiwis in the house, but I made a tomato salsa that was simple but refreshing.    We're not fans of the creama, so I substituted with a homemade queso fresco and cilantro dip instead.   The important point is that the basic taco filling is a very good one and it is capable of being personalized with the salsas and accompaniments of your choice. ", '          This recipe was very good, but there is no way this will feed 6 people. ', "          I have no idea why this recipe doesn't have more reviews! I never write reviews, but I feel like I should with this one. I've done this more then 5 times already and it ALWAYS comes out tasting amazing. It's easy, but it does take a few extra steps like when making the salsa and crema, but it's always worth it! One thing though is I prefer the salsa with MANGO instead of kiwi. And I use CUBANELLE peppers instead of poblano. Everything else stays the same. Lastly, I assume the Mexican seasoning is like taco seasoning? So I just use a packet of taco seasoning. Sooooo delicious! ", "          Followed the meat  & crema recipe exactly, doubled the salsa and added mango.  We used crumbled queso fresco as a topping, my husband and I also used a dash of Jalapeno/Poblano Choulula on ours.  It's going into our family rotation, and has landed on the list of football party foods.  Total winner here folks. ", '           These were so good, will definitely make them again. I added some of the cilantro and extra lime juice to the crema for extra and put some shredded cotija cheese on top. ', "          I don't usually do an all-pork taco, but the salsa and lime crema made me want to try this recipe. I followed it with the following exceptions: "]

name: Strawberry, Kiwi, and Spinach Salad
comments: ['          Great recipe on a hot summer day.  I sprinkled on some feta cheese. ', '          This is a terrific salad and so easy. Here are my tweaks. I made this for a salad luncheon the other day and didn‚Äôt use kiwi because it didn‚Äôt look great at the store. But our fresh local strawberries are in season so I used those, the feta and walnuts generously and made the dressing with homemade raspberry preserves. ', "          This is not a low-carb recipe. It's got tons of sugars in it from all the fruit! ", '          Very good! Loved it. Used balsamic vinaigrette as the dressing ', '          Very easy to pull together.  I did add Dijon mustard as one reviewer suggested and I think it added a new dimension to the dressing.  I also used EVOO.  Very tasty with the salad. ', "          I made this for my husband's family who don't eat salads on a regular basis & they really liked it.  Especially the dressing (my addition was 3T of fresh squeezed orange juice to give it a little citrus-y vibe). Then doubled the recipe to make sure there was enough.  Glad for the extra as it was all gone & the salad bowl was empty.  Going to make this anytime someone asks me to bring the greens. ", "          Didn't change a thing.  It was wonderful. ", '          I made it to bring to a potluck lunch and it was yummy. I will definitely make it again! ', '          Made this last night! Hubby loved it as well! Cut portions down to two. Made as directed. Will definitely make again. Will try with pumpkin seeds for family with nut allergies. ']

name: Supreme Green Smoothie
comments: ["          This was really good! The amount of ingredients would have made way too much for just my daughter and I so I just eyeballed the amounts for a smaller smoothie and it tasted great. I didn't have the almond milk with honey so I used regular almond milk and added some honey. Really delicious and even my 5 year old daughter drank every drop! ", '          Skipped the milk, added lemon juice, cucumbers, aloe vera and freshly grated ginger ', "           I didn't measure they way they did but I followed most of the ingredients. Swapped kale for spinach, added oats for my own health and honey. ", '          Tastes great. Would not use this for anything more than a dessert. WAY TOO MUCH sugar. ', '          No and yes ', "          I made my first smoothie with this recipe..the kiwi taste is very nice, I wasn't able to find the almond milk with honey, so used regular almond instead..it was tasty ", "          I use spinach, frozen tropical fruit, squirt of honey. Bariatric Fusion Protein powder, Chai seeds and collagen powder and blended  with Non sweetened Vanilla almond milk. This is my go to daily breakfast since I had bariatric surgery in 2017..don't like kale because its bitter tasting to me ", '          Good Health Drink! Instead Of Frozen Fruits, I Prefer Using Fresh Stuff. I Used Fresh Pineapple, Available In My Local Indian Market All Year! All The Items In This Recipe Are My Favorites! Thanks For Sharing! ']

name: Furutsu Sando (Fruit Sandwiches)
comments: ['          Really tasty and a fun experience! ']

name: Tropical Kiwi Ice Pops
comments: ['          Yummy ', "          Loved these indeed!  The right amount of fruit and coconut made for a wonderful frozen delight. I only got three popsicles though...I wonder if me drinking half of the mixture as a smoothie had something to do with it? :-) Make a double batch of these otherwise you'll be writing a review of a wonderful smoothie. Delicious frozen and just as is! Thank you MsNingyoo for this perfectly calculated recipe. ", '          these are great. very refreshing. I substituted stevia for sugar. ', '          I used sweetened vanilla coconut milk and omitted sugar. I also blended the kiwi into the mix instead of having it chunky. As promised, they were light and refreshing, perfect for an ungodly hot summer day. ', "           Oh yes, this recipe is a keeper.  We thoroughly enjoyed these creamy ice pops.  The coconut, banana, pineapple, and kiwi are perfectly balanced, with not one dominating, with the flavor leaning toward a pina colada IMO.  I used light coconut milk and sub'd Truvia for the sugar.  Another thing you'll like about this recipe is how easy it is to make.  These would be the absolutely perfect snack or dessert for a summer BBQ (actually perfect any time in this house!).  Well done MsNingyoo. "]

name: Kiwi-Lime Pork Ribs
comments: ['          thought it would be spicier.. next time I will use s bit more kiwi and lime juice.. ', "          It was very easy and had a wonderful taste.  I did follow the suggestion of another reviewer and reduce the amount of salt from 2 tablespoons to 2 teaspoons and I'm very glad I did.  I think it would have been way to salty with 2 tablespoons of salt.  I also reduced the amount of chili powder by half because I'm not fond of it.  So those modifications made it perfect for my tastes.  I will definitely make again. ", '           Well I had to make some substitutes but it was fantastic. The first one was instead of the three pounds of ribs I used 1.5 pounds of left over rib meat. The next was I didn‚Äôt have chili powder so I subbed in Chinese Five spice. If you have never used it you need to buy it. Lastly instead of minced garlic I used 1/2 tsp of garlic powder. It turned out amazing and with some mashed potatoes it is defiantly an easy dinner while using leftovers. ', '          This was different, but in a good way. An unexpected flavor combination on pork, but it works! ', '          I heeded the comments from others about the amount salt and cut it back dramatically. Also, I highly recommend lining the baking dish as once baked, the sauce becomes hardened in the pan. But the flavor is delicious! ', '          This recipe was delicious.   My husband is not a big fan of barbecue ribs and this is a great recipe alternative for something different.   The only change I made was the salt.  I used 2 teaspoons.  Great flavor combinations with the chili powder, limes, and kiwi.  I will definitely share this recipe. ', "          I don't eat pork but this sauce goes GREAT with chicken. Like others, I halved the salt and used 3 kiwis instead of two, and brown sugar. Yummmm.... ", '          I thought this was a really good dish.  I used 3 Kiwis and cut down the salt and chili powder as others suggested.  I also used honey instead of white sugar and it was really good. ', "          Thanks for posting this recipe!  Note that the sauce is very forgiving.  On short notice I used peaches instead of kiwis and lemon juice instead of lime, and still got rave reviews from the family.  Also used cayenne to make up for a slight deficiency in the chili powder. Next time I'll go with the lime juice and, as others have said, halve the salt.  I think pitted cherries or apricots would also work instead of kiwis.  Would appreciate any hints on reducing the sugar, perhaps substituting Splenda, to make it more diabetic friendly. "]

name: Caribbean Health Drink
comments: ["          Excellent and filling! But I think liquid was not put on the list of ingredients. Lack of liquid isn't good for the juicer and makes the smoothie/juice easier to drink. ", "          It was okay, I might make it again if we have leftover food and need to use it up, but it wouldn't be my top choice. ", '          This is absolutely delicious! ', '          This one is pretty good. I added coconut water so that it would blend and it ended up being a good addition. I would make this one again. ', '          It was great and great choice of using the carrot! Also thanks to the comments for saying to add water otherwise it would have probably been a chunky mess. One tip is maybe find some more sweeter fruits or use honey to give it more of a sweet taste to satisfy the sweet tooth. Best of luck to whoever makes it next! ', '          Too thick and the flavor was a bit too sour with the kiwi and pineapple. ', "          Good stuff. Didn't have any pineapples, so I added 1/2 C of OJ, as well as 6 oz of plain yogurt. I liked it enough and so did my 2 yo. I great way to get him to get the benefits of vegetables...so that's good enough for me! ", "           A smoothie with a carrot?  Wasn't sure I was going to like that, but I did.  The flavors blended well together and it made for a nice filling breakfast.  I would have liked it a little more on the tart side, but that aside, a good drink. ", '          The smoothie was terrible. We used all the ingredients listed, We spent about 30 min. Chopping all the fruits and veggies. We were really disappointed on how it all  came out. To make it taste a little bit better we added 2 tbsp. and it tasted much better. All in all it was not the best. ']

name: Spicy Fruit Salsa
comments: ['          I actually enjoyed the heat. Rather than using as a salsa pureed it as a sauce over al pastor quesadillas. Awesome! ', '          Like the other reviews noted, this does turn out watery. I remedied that by placing the salsa into a colander lined with paper towels for about 20 minutes, and it was perfect. Since the other reviews noted that this is super spicy, I cut the cayenne and habanero sauce both in half, and it was still plenty spicy. I also added a teaspoon of salt, and I think it needs a little more of a zesty lime flavor - like maybe some grated lime peel or something along the lines of the lime chips. ', '          I really wasnt sure about the spicy mixed with fruit but it was incredible. I am going to use it with a chicken dish next. ', '          Wonderful! I have used mango jam and pepper jelly and both turned out so very tasty. A few small preference changes. I used apricots instead of Kiwi to please my husband and I used fuji apples because I read somewhere they dont brown as easy. I also chose to use honey instead of sugar once and it was great. I paired this with homemade cinnamon tortilla chips. It makes a great pic nic item. Yum! ', "          I made this for a 4th of July party. Instead of the black berries I used blueberries. Not only did it make the recipe red white and blue, they were alot cheaper than the blackberries because they were in season. I only used 1 and 1/4 tablespoons of habenero sauce, and only 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne. It had just the right amount of kick. I can't imagine how hot it would be if made it as it is called for. Sweet, spicy, and refreshing for a hot summer day! ", "           A fresh and fruity alternative to regular salsa for eating with tortilla chips.  After reading the other reviews I started with only half the cayenne and hot sauce, and then added a bit more to my taste.  I used Golden Delicious and Macintosh apples, and red salsa since that's what I had on hand and it was still yummy.  Definitely allow more time than 15 min. for all the chopping! ", "          Ohhh it burns so good!  I found this recipe a few years ago, and my family has been begging for me to make it again. It's yummy. Don't think of it as chunky salsa. Think of it as a sauce with spicy sweetness, that puts a twist on the style of salsa.   ", '          Quite an unusual salsa and spicy enough even when only using half of the hot sauce and cayenne pepper.  Delicious served with lime tostido chips.  I did not add all the "liquid ingredients" (jelly, green salsa, hot sauce) to avoid the salsa being "too runny". Chopping and assembling ingredients take way longer than 15 minutes prep time and served way more than 12.  I ended up freezing half.  Would I make it again~~YES!  It is yummy!  :) ', '          LOVED THE SPICY SWEET TASTE.  I ALSO CUT BACK THE HOT SAUCE, BUT LEFT ALOT OF BITE STILL TO THE RECIPE.  GOT RAVE REVIEWS FROM FRIENDS AND COWORKERS. ']

name: Pavlova Deluxe
comments: ['           Absolutely delish!! I loved it!! ', '          I made it exactly as instructed by ingredients but I didn‚Äôt use a springform pan I just traced a circle on parchment paper and formed my meringue by using a spatula to build up the wall edge.  The shape held up perfectly while baking and it was a huge success.  I used ganache to add a little drippings down the side and a little more on the berries. It was very beautiful, I‚Äôll attach a picture. ', "           Couldn't find my mother's Pavlova recipe so I tried this one. Don't tell my mother, but I prefer this recipe. The center is beautifully soft like a lemon meringue while the outside is firm and chewy. Absolutely delicious! ", '          excellent. i put it on parchment paper , traced a 9 inch circle as a guide, instead of a springform  pan. ', '          Best recipe ever! ', '          Fantastic!   Had dinner party last week including a couple of fussy eaters - this was the one desert that was entirely devoured!  Very easy -my daughter who is not a fruit lover dripped melted chocolate over the whipped cream and we put a bowl of berries on the side for those so inclined- making this again right now for a friends party! ', '          Perfect every time. ', "          Yum. That's all I can say about this easy, elegant and tasty desert. Works great with a big dollop of cream and tons of fresh raspberries. ", '          This tasted too "eggy" for us. ']

name: White Sangria with Kiwi
comments: ['          Yummy!! ', "          This sangria is very light, refreshing and delicious.  I especially like that, unlike many other sangria recipes, it doesn''t include brandy, which in my opinion weights it down and takes away from the lovely fruitiness.  But that is our personal preference.  A very versatile and adaptable recipe. ", '          instead of diluting your drink with ice cubes....i froze the green grapes and used them.  this is an easy and awesome summer time drink and refreshing. ', '          Fantastic!!! Easy to make..taste good..we liked this;-) ', '          Adding 1/2 cup of brandy scant 3 tablespoons, but I also added the 3 tablespoons of Grand Marnier.', "           I liked this, but was looking for a little more of the orange liqueur flavor, so I did bump up the Gran Marnier a little.  I really prefer the more traditional white sangria with brandy (but that's just a personal taste preference).  Realized after taking the photo that I forgot to add the pear, but I added it later along with a few blueberries.  This made it even more of a refreshing summer drink with a fruit salad on the bottom :-)     Thanks Monica Joy for a nice summer drink for a BBQ. "]

name: Strawberry Kiwi Tartlets
comments: ['          This was good recipe but when I was making it we couldn‚Äôt find the correct puff pastry and so we made it with puff pastry sheets. It came out good anyway. It was sweet and tart and the whipped cream added extra flavor and it was very nice alltogether. ', '          Delicious! my only suggestion would be that when you blenderize the kiwis with honey, puree the kiwis first, THEN put the honey in.  i put the honey in first, and it all sunk to the bottom of the processor.   ', '          I used the recipe for the idea and took of with my own version. I used puffed pastry in the Pampered Chef tart pan, omitted the Kiwi and Honey part.  Then used a tub of  Fat Free cool whip with 1/2 tsp cinnamon for the topping.    I got rave reviews but I will try again.    ', "          Good solid dessert.  I didn't think the kiwi/honey combo was as good as plain kiwi would have been.  Also a little messy/tough to eat.  Overall the taste was good. I added a bit more sugar to the whip cream and doubled the amount of whip cream suggested in order to have enough whip cream for all six that I made.  In short, good, but I'll probably try a few other strawberry desserts before returning to this one. ", '          These were great and really easy to make.  I did everything according to the recipe, but the kiwis at our local market looked really bad, so I used mangoes instead.  I brought them to a get together and they were gone right off!  Thanks for sharing!  ', '           These were very good and my family thought that I bought them at the store!  Maybe I should be offended...anyway, they turned out great! ', '          This was a fantastic snack! It was easy to make and it tasted wonderful! Except how do you take the seeds out of the kiwis? I just cut them out in a way! Then again it was very good and I plan on making it again sometime! ', "           I didn't take the seeds out of the kiwis... how do you even do that?  Being new to puff pastry, I didn't let it rise enough so it was doughy and not big enough to fit all of the strawberry filling.  All in all, it was a good recipe and I might try it again. ", '          Wow! I made these tartlets for my foods class and they were awesome. The glaze on the shells was amazing. They were a tad messy when eating but so worth it! ']

name: LaWanna's Mango Salsa on Tilapia Fillets
comments: ['          I loved the flavours in the salsa mix!  I did not use the rice as a bed, only the salsa for the tilapia bed.  It was absolutely delicious with all the different flavours! ', '          Variation on a theme ‚Äî used homemade market fresh pineapple base mango salsa, coated fish in spices and cornmeal prior to frying ‚Äî super delicious ', '          Made this following recipe to a tee. No one wanted to eat it. too much vinegar and fish tasted flavorless. ', '           I added salt, pepper, garlic powder and onion powder to the fish before pan-frying. None of my family likes the tomatoes in what we called the "fruit salad." So they will be left off the next time. ', '          i loved it it was really good but i wanted the salsa to be really HOT!!!!!!!!!!!!!! :) ', "          This was pretty good. With all the lovely fresh veggies around this was a great way getting hubby to eat fish (that isn't fried) because he loves pineapplel and mango.   The fish was pretty plain so I added some smoked paprika before I grilled it.  As for the salsa - I liked the balsamic in the salsa - hubby did not care for it.  I think he thought it would have a terriyaki flavor with the pineapple and mango.  Thanks for an inspiring recipe. "]

name: A Drama Queen's Pavlova
comments: ['          I‚Äôve made this multiple times because family and friends request it! It‚Äôs a great recipe with no corn starch, no flour so it can be enjoyed by many who have these allergies.  It‚Äôs quite simple as long as you know your soft peaks from your hard ones. My daughter also bakes this now and also for repeat performances.  She arranges the fruit beautifully and elevates this into an art form. ', '          Made exactly to recipe and it was delicious and turned out perfectly. We have made this many times. ', "          I live in the States and have made this a couple of times now for Easter, it makes a beautiful spring dessert. I make it with homemade whipped cream, and no added sugar. I agree the cream should not be sweetened as the combination is perfect: sweet meringue, lovely cream and sweet/tangy fruit. I use a combination of berries, kiwi and mango. My whole family loves this. We had not tried this dessert before I found this recipe but now it's a favorite! (I skip the coconut and almond due to allergies, but I'm sure they would be marvelous additions) Thanks for sharing this, I'm not a huge sweets person but this is in my top 3! ", '          I\'ve made this twice for guests and all enjoyed it.  The first time I put it on parchment using a 9" circle, and the second time I used a parchment lined 11" porcelain tart pan.  Both worked fine though the cookie sheet method allowed the meringue to expand  without restriction.  I did sweeten the the whipped cream.  It was delicious!  It\'s a great make ahead dessert and looks gorgeous. ', "          This recipe makes 2 large pavlova! We gobbled up the first one, but didn't have room for the second.  Pretty easy to make,  and looks beautiful. ", '          I followed the recipe to the T and it did not turn out right, but it did taste good. My mom hates anything with coconut in it and she realy liked this. ', '          Great recipe!  Great texture! New and unique (in the US at least!) It is an easy recipe that puts to use leftover egg whites!  I like to make this after I have made eggnog (recipe from this site) or traditional vanilla pudding (recipe also from this site).  You could make it any flavor I believe.  I add amaretto liquor to mine to make it almond flavor. ', '           This was a HIT with my family and friends!!  I made this for a summer treat and quickly found out that I have to make more than just one each time I make it! My kids can eat an entire Pavlova by themselves (a 3 and 6 year old)!  We love this recipe and everyone in the family now has a copy of it!  Thanks for sharing :) ', "          Not bad, I am an Aussie that lives in the US.  Pavlova is probably my favorite dessert. I think my Mom makes one of the best Pav's around.  I LOVE passionfruit and it is the real/traditional topping for Pavlova.  Passionfruit makes this dessert, it is not the same without it; in fact it would just be a meringue topped with fruit.  I LOVE PASSIONFRUIT, and that's how REAL Aussie's make it. "]

name: Creamy Kiwi Sandwich
comments: ['          I added a bit more honey and lemon zest for more tang! ', '          This was delicious! I used lemon juice instead of lemon zest and did not refrigerate over night, but it turned out great. This is one of my new favorites for a quick, tasty breakfast. ', '          Wow! Very good. What a unique way to eat a kiwi! I just had to try this as I had one kiwi left and all the other ingredients on hand.  I just eyeballed every thing and didn\'t bother to let the ingredients "develop" for a day. Who can wait that long? I could only wait long enough to lightly toast my bread..... ', "          My kids thought this was great. They've been on this whole kiwi kick for almost two weeks now, so this was a great way to use up more. I didn't chop the kiwi fruit, I just sliced it like I would for a tomato sandwich. I also didn't have time to refrigerate the spread. This was a great way to use up ingredients I always have on hand and clear out the fridge before grocery day. Thanks. ", "           I REALLY enjoyed this sandwich! I made it on a whim, so I didn't have time to let the cream cheese mixture refrigerate overnight, but it sure was tasty. I just eye-balled everything to taste, and used dried lemon peel and whipped cream cheese for easier mixing/spreading. I served this on lightly toasted Italian-style sliced bread. This was also a big hit with my little guy. I will definately be making this again! Thanks for sharing. :) ", "          This was really yummy.  I didn't have any lemons on hand, so I used lemon curd and skipped the honey.  Such a different idea, but one that we loved. ", "          I made these for a birthday party and they got mixed reviews.  Some people liked them, but others took one bite and didn't finish it.  Personally I liked the mix of honey and kiwi.   "]

name: Char Siu (Chinese Barbeque Pork)
comments: ['           Very delicious. This recipe will work with any pork. I will do this recipe wit boneless pork ribs and pork ribeyes ', '           I made exactly as the recipe specified with the exception of marinating 24 hours instead of 2 days.  Super delicious recipe.  Great flavor!  This would probably be good seared on the grill at the end instead of broiled as well. ']

name: Strawberry-Kiwi Slush
comments: ['           Hard to believe it\'s 97 degrees F on the back porch this early in May.  I\'m ready for something to cool me down, and this did the trick.  I was expecting something a bit "fruitier" tasting, so next time I\'ll just eliminate the water; as the ice melts, diluting the fruit flavor will happen naturally.  Hubs thought it was a little tart, so I\'ll try cutting the lemon juice in half next time (admittedly, all of this is personal taste preference).  This was very refreshing, and you don\'t need to worry about calories and fat (which is often the case with smoothies), so you can sip without guilt!  GoodCook, thanks for a great afternoon snack! ']

name: Lemon Pretzel Salad with Mango and Kiwi
comments: ['          Really good!  I followed the recipe exactly, but I would make a few adjustments.  First of all, 3/4 cup butter is waaaay too much!  I would cut down to about 1/4 cup; do 1/2 water & 1/2 lemon juice in the Jell-o; omit kiwi and add more mango (Kiwi reacts funny in Jell-o and it was a little runny); and I think it would be good even with a pineapple Jell-o and maybe some coconut in the crust even! ', '          Still one of my favorite recipes to make.  In high demand in my household, regardless of the season. I still can‚Äôt get the kiwi right, but that‚Äôs me, not the recipe ', "          Weirdly good.  It was a lot of work for a novelty salad, but everyone enjoyed it, I had no leftovers, and several folks asked for the recipe.  Maybe it just seemed like a lot of work, after all.  The flavors were nice and balanced; I'll make this one again.  Thank you for submitting the recipe. ", "           I really enjoyed this! It was a lot of work, though. I used a springform pan, so I cut the amounts slightly. I ground pretzels in the food processor (about 1 3/4 c. total). I used 2 Tbsp plus 1 tsp brown sugar, and only 6 Tbsp butter (but probably could've used a full half cup). While the crust baked, I rinsed out the food processor and used it to blend the cream cheese and sugar, then lemon juice and vanilla. Transferred to a bowl and stirred in the lemon zest. I'm not a fan of Cool-Whip, so I whipped 6 oz of heavy cream and folded it into the cream cheese. Delicious! It was just the right sweetness (even with unsweetened whipped cream), with a great lemon flavor. [I only used 3/4 c cream because I wanted to be sure the filling was firm enough to slice.] While the filling chilled, I BLANCHED THE KIWI. The gelatin won't set otherwise. I peeled and sliced the kiwi, placed slices in a strainer, and lowered it into boiling water. Blanched it for about 45 seconds, transferred the strainer to an ice water bath, and then set kiwi slices aside with the mango. For the gelatin, I used the ice water bath from blanching the kiwi to chill the gelatin mixture until it was ready to pour on the fruit. My verdict? I thought the lemon Jell-O detracted from the rest of the dessert. Next time, I'd play with using fruit juice (mango, or passionfruit) and use 1 pack unsweetened gelatin. Just enough to make a shiny, fruity glaze‚Äînot so much for a floating gelatin layer. But I will try this again! "]

name: Simple Strawberry Salsa
comments: ['          I\'ve made Strawberry Salsa many times over the years and also serve with cinnamon chips for dipping. Agree with previous post, I use fresh pineapple so no need for adding white sugar especially if using in season Strawberries. I\'ve found when making ahead, the Kiwi turns a bit pink and "slimy" in appearance. Omit the Kiwi if you\'re making the previous day. Fresh Mango is a great addition. ', "           Breakfast today was this salsa served with cinnamon-sugar baked tortilla chips.  If you need a recipe for the tortilla chips, see Annie's Fruit Salsa and Cinnamon Chips on this site.  I had fresh pineapple, so I used that instead of canned, and the orange, strawberries, and kiwi were perfectly ripe, so I didn't need the sugar.  Just simple, fresh fruit flavor at its best! "]

name: Kale with Kiwi
comments: ['           I was skeptical about this but it actualy taste good. Im knew to kale I like it, think bits if bacon wiuld taste good in this recpie ', "           The taste is very weird. I didn't have fresh ingredients, so used dried basil, regular salt and pepper, squeeze bottle ginger and garlic, olive oil. ", '          I didn‚Äôt have kiwi so I substituted diced apple instead, and even then it was wonderful! I was looking for something I had in the house that could give more of the tangy flavour of kiwi, so I sprinkled some with craisens. Both ways were delicious! But now I want to buy kiwi and try it again - can‚Äôt wait! ', "          It's delicious and unique. I put it in the fridge and eat it cold. I like how the kiwi with the coconut oil makes its own dressing. I use red kale because I don't like larcinato. ", '          This was very nice. I added a small number of blackberries that needed to be used up& tried lo-cal bacon crumbles on it. Both worked well. It took longer than 5minutes for the kale to be as wilted as I desired but it was still a quick dish to make. ', '          Man, this was good. ', "          wow, this was surprising. I really didn't think it would be good at all but I'm glad I tried it because I never would have thought of this combo and it's awesome! a nice alternative to the standard vinegar and soy sauce style of preparing kale. I could also see this working well with citrus like grapefruit instead of kiwi. lots of potential here. ", '          Yummy! I love the flavor combo of these powerhouse foods together. The only thing I did different was to use KerryGold grass fed butter instead of coconut oil because I was out. The tanginess of the kiwi really complimented the ginger and garlic. This one is a winner. ', "           This recipe looked so interesting I just had to try it.  I doubled the ingredients (for four servings) and made it as written except for using curly kale and substituted 1 tbsp dried oregano for the fresh. Sorry, but nobody in my family including myself cared for it. The oregano was especially overpowering, and the kiwi tasted like very sour lemon. If I ever make this again I think I'd cut the oregano way down and use only half (or less) of the kiwi called for. "]

name: Crazy Fruit Smoothie
comments: ['           YUM!!! No changes necessary. ', '          I used bananas, strawberries, raspberries, pineapple, coconut cream and mango juice. Made a wonderful midday snack. ', '          I think I am the only one that made this smoothie and realized there was no liquid in the recipe! I made 1/2 recipe as the calories were rather high for 1 serving. Most of my fruit was frozen, so that may have been partially the problem. However, I never saw a smoothie without any liquid. For 1/2 the recipe I added 1 cup of almond milk. Besides that, the flavor was pretty good. ty ', '          I had a frozen banana that I used in this smoothie which eliminated the need for ice. I also do not keep cream of coconut on hand but I did have some fat free evaporated milk--I used that and a half teaspoon of coconut extract. Very tasty smoothie. I\'m glad that it didn\'t call for additional sugar because it was plenty sweet on it\'s own. Has a "tropical" feel to it. I liked this smoothie a lot. ', '          i liked it but i made it without coconut ', '          Absolutely delicious! ', '           I loved this smoothie - but you need to like coconut to enjoy it.  The kiwi added just the right amount of tartness to this drink.  Made it for my breakfast and it hit the spot.  Thanks for sharing. ', '          delicious! ', '          delicious! ']

name: Healthier Absolutely the Best Chocolate Chip Cookies
comments: ["          I didn't care for the cake-like texture so next time I'll just omit an egg. Love the multigrain cheerio idea though. I may try the peanut butter ones next time also. ", "          Didn't care for texture of dough, plus lacked in flavour. ", '          I was seriously disappointed with this recipe. They may be healthier, but for me it definitely took a toll on the taste. ', '           WOW!!!! these are the best cookies ever!!! my husband and daughters loved them so much. I like the fact that I can used my old cheerios cereal and kiwi!!! I am guessing you could use any other fruit to make them. I KEEPER! ', '           Love this recipe, these cookies disappeared in a blink of an eye. Trying it with sound other mix ins, and fully expecting it to be equally fantastic. ', '          I to randomly had all the ingredients, i used rolled oats and mine were just a hair on the dry side. But supper easy. I love the kind of recipes that you just mix it all together and bake. They were devoured at my house dry or not.  And my 4 yr old just loved helping me make them. ', "           The Cheerios and pureed kiwi was an interesting twist so I wanted to give it a try. To be honest I didn't know what to expect after I decided to make this recipe. I happen to have all the ingredients on hand, well I had Peanut Butter Cheerios and Chocolate Cheerios so I went with the Peanut Butter. The cookies didn't brown much when I took them out of the oven. I allowed them to cool and tasted and was surprised this is a fantastic cake-like cookie. "]

name: Fruit Pizza Trifles To Go
comments: ['           This is a fun, delicious dessert.   It was a big hit at my dinner party!  Thanks for sharing your recipe! ', '           Instead of making these "to go," I scaled the recipe to 2 servings as a snack for my preschooler and me. She had trouble getting the cream from the bottom of the cup and in the end had cream leftover. I think there is enough mixture that you could make 2 layers of fruit and cream, and that would help incorporate throughout the cup. These were tasty and fun; thanks for the idea! ', '          made this for a womens book group, and it was wonderful!  everyone wanted the recipe.  My only advice is that after a while the cookies can get soggy and it is much better with crisp cookies.  Put them together at the last minute. ', '          These were great!  I made as written with the exception of using canned pineapple and frozen bluberries.  It was pretty and delicious.  I will definitely make again.  It\'s something my kids enjoyed helping with.  I\'m looking forward to trying with different fruit combos and also may try almond or amaretto flavor instead of vanilla in the cream cheese.  Thank you "lovestohost"!  It\'s a keeper!! ', '          This was a 4th of July hit!  I followed the directions for the cream cheese layer, but only used blueberries and strawberries to follow the red, white, and blue theme.  FYI, I used a 1/4 cup of blueberries for the bottom layer and two heaping tablespoons of strawberries for the top layer.  I sprinkled some toffee chips on the top too for crunch and flavor.  Like I said, this was a huge hit.  I love not having to bring food back home from a party.  :) ', '          Fantastic recipe...dont need to alter anything.  I took this to Parent night at my kids school and these were a major hit! ', "           Okay...I just tried this and LOVED it! I ended up using peaches, strawberries and blueberries! And I scaled it down to one serving...just for me! I didn't have any sugar cookies, so I used strawberry Cheerios! This was VERY good! Great recipe LTH! "]

name: Sweet Salsa and Cinnamon Chips
comments: ["          Wow! This is definitely very refreshing and not to mention a wonderful combination of colors and flavors. No matter what assortment of fresh fruit you use it's bound to be good so use your favorites and use the recipe as a guide. I added chopped peaches to mine and used fresh strawberries. Baking the chips keeps this a little healthier and lower in fat. So, for the cinnamon chips I used reduced fat tortillas and cut them with a pizza cutter which made things a lot easier. I sprayed them with butter flavored Pam and sprinkled them with the cinnamon sugar. I baked them at 350 for 8 minutes flipped them and baked them for another 7 minutes. They were crispy and delicious - next time I would double the amount because they went fast. This got a lot of compliments not only for taste, but for creativity. I'll definitely make this again - great recipe! ", '          Even the kids liked it.  Made the salsa with just strawberries and bananas with a little sugar for them. ', '          I accidentally bought the wrong size tortillas. I had the fajita size which looked like about 6." So, I used 5 instead of 3. I thought the cinnamon sugar looked like way to much. I did 1/2 cup sugar mixed with 1 Tablespoon of cinnamon, and still had some left using half. This recipe and others do not say what type of cooking spray to use. I believe I bought the wrong one. Mine was more like a butter than a spray and my chips were kind of soggy! I think it means a cooking spray like Pam. I do not like kiwi, so I left that out, but added some chopped strawberries, but think the peach idea would have been better. I also added a couple sprinkles of sugar, as the chips already have sugar. ', '          needed something to keep my nieces and nephew happy and they would all eat.  This was GREAT! Made the chips in small batches (I did burn the first one) and found that I needed to clean the pan about every other batch as the sugar became burnt syrup when left on the pan. So very tasty and a creative way to use up some of my Kiwis.  ', '          I am rating the chips only.  They were easy to make and very good.  I make my own fruit salsa recipe, from red apple, grapes, strawberries, peach and preserves.  ', '          I used another reviewers advice and added peaches to the recipe. I made the cinnamon chips but also purchased a box of graham cracker sticks for my son to dip. Yum! ', '          This is always a huge hit at parties!  I add a small amount of sugar to the strawberries while blending and pair this salsa with the cream cheese/ marshmallow fluff dip.  Perfect! ', "          This is definitely a refreshing treat and a  healthy snack for the kids. We've used graham crackers or the graham cracker sticks for dipping too! If you really want to save time, throw the fruit into your food processor and just chop! ", '          Wonderful! So refreshing on a warm summer day. I made this take to a party and ended up eating a lot of it myself. Oops. Definitely a keeper. ']

name: Tart Tropical Parfait
comments: ['           I made all three of these parfait recipes, and according to my husband, they are all "keepers." ']

name: Grilled Tilapia with Mango Salsa
comments: ['          Really enjoyed this.  Subbed cod (frozen, from Costco) but  otherwise stuck to the recipe ingredients/directions.  Had mango salsa left over from a previous night - it went perfectly with the fish.  Made a black bean and brown rice combo to complement the fish. ', '           Big hit with the wife. She thought I should have saved it for Valentines Day.I prepared the fish per the recipe (3 minutes per side), though I did marinate it for two hours.For the salsa, I added fresh pineapple and next time will add more red onion.Served it over buttered, lemon and garlic basmati rice.Great recipe! Thank you. ', '           This recipe is absolutely delicious!!  I‚Äôm getting ready to make this for my second time.  I don‚Äôt like cilantro at all so I didn‚Äôt add that and I went ahead and diced a peach in with the mango salsa.  It‚Äôs soooo good, it‚Äôs like eating at a 5 star restaurant.  Paired well with lemon herb rice and lemon pepper broccoli on the side. ', '          This mango salsa is delicious and can stand on its own. I think any fresh fish would go great with the salsa. BTW, I used an orange pepper instead of red and my family loved it. ', '          Really enjoyed this, as did the whole family ', "          This is the second time in two weeks that I have made this recipe! It's now my favorite tilapia recipe! The mango salsa is so refreshing!  This is definitely a keeper! ", "          I used Atlantic Haddock (we don't eat tilapia) and I left out the cilantro (yuck!). This was a five star meal. The salsa was fantastic. I added some ripe nectarines to the mango as my mango wasn't fully ripe. The nectarines sweetened it up....delicious!...Had it with caramelized maple sweet potatoes and freshly picked white corn. ", "          I've made this recipe twice in two weeks and i can see it being on the menu frequently at our house.  The salsa alone is fabulous.  First time i made with tilapia.  The second time i made it with seared tuna - same marinade and i put an extra jalapeno in the salsa.  A keeper for sure! ", '          Made exactly as written. ']

name: Jicama Mango Salad with Cilantro and Lime
comments: ["          It was very easy to make, it just took a little bit of time to chop everything, but that could have been since I made a quad batch! It was a big hit at my event and several people asked for the recipe. I'd never used mangos or jicama before and learned that you can peel them with an vegetable peeler. ", '          Love this salad!! So much fresher than   a plain old coleslaw.I ran out of  red peppers so I diced up  an avocado  and added it to the salad for colour. ', '          Awesome Used mangoes that were in a jar my red onion was a bit strong for the dish otherwise it was delicious ', '          Delicious! ', "          Delicious, perfect. Can't wait to put it on fish tacos tonight!! ", '          I love this recipe! Super easy, healthy and delicious ingredients with very little prep time required. I took it to a party and it was a hit! I love it when I see people going back for seconds and asking for the recipe. I‚Äôm making it again for my family tonight! ', '          Superb..but...very labor intensive, despite what one person said.  But well worth it!  I cut my jicama on the mandolin and after struggling mightily, due to how hard it was, I ended up only cutting half of it into matchsticks.  I was just worn out!   ( I put the other half of the sliced jicama in the fridge for later use).  ', '          I cut all the ingredients the night before except the red onions ( can‚Äôt eat raw onions)', '          Made this for our Father‚Äôs Day lunch yesterday. Everyone loved it! ']

name: Mango Jam
comments: ['          I got the tip from one of the reviews. Added lemon and lemon zest. So fruity indeed! ', "          Quick and easy recipe everyone seemed to enjoy. It's a do-again! ", "          I frequently make jam and can it (my family hasn't purchased jam in a decade). I used mangos that were probably more ripe than the author intended. I had 5 large mangos to mix with the syrup. I used a stick blender to mostly puree the mangos, leaving a couple of chunks for texture. I added the juice of half a lemon and the sliced peel (not the pulp) for added pectin and thickening power. I boiled all of that for about 30 min to get to soft jam consistency. The lemon helped to balance the sweetness and the added acid will help prevent spoilage. In the future, I would use a whole lemon and its peel. If you slice the peel thinly, it will break down nicely in the jam. ", '          Great recipe. I followed other recommendations and added only 1 cup of sugar with a bit of lime zest. it was enough sweet so I recommend to add only a cup of sugar. A definite keeper ', '          Too many mangos not enough jars... first time making this recipe, something to go on. ', '          I didn‚Äôt see anything about the expected yield. How many 1/2 pint jars should this recipe make? ', '           I made the recipe as is, minus the saffron as my mangoes were ripe and needed no help in color. I‚Äôm giving the recipe a 2 Star due to the jam not setting up at all even though the sugar mix set perfectly. I‚Äôm not sure if I had too much mango pulp or not enough pulp because I had no clue as to weight. Most kitchens don‚Äôt have a scale to measure 2 lbs of mangoes so I had to guess. Cups of mango chunks, pur√©e would have been helpful vs. as written. I‚Äôm passing on using in the future but it was fun trying and it is delicious but will use it more as a topping for desserts than a jam. ', "           I followed the recipe exactly, substituting 1 Tblsp of ground ginger for the saffron. So good! I'm going to use some of it as a filling in a sweet bread braid I'm making. I can't wait to see how the bread turns out! ", "          Very easy to make! I doubled the cooking time and added Orange zest and it's delicious! "]

name: Mango-Habanero Chicken Wings
comments: ["          I'm Italian I have to have more garlic I put it another Cobra garlic in there it seem to be pretty good after that ", '          Use a blender not a food processor. Definitely reduce the butter to 2 tablespoons. ', '          Very very good, heat level was lower than expected, next time I might add a few more habaneros. Also I used a mango instead of mango nectar. I believe this made the sauce thicker and stuck to the wings real nicely. I also substituted soy sauce with seasame seed oil which I think enhanced the flavor a little bit. ', '          So delicious we had to make them again after 2 days ', '          I used the half a stick of butter suggestion and it turned out amazing. ', '          very similar Buffalo Wild Wings recipe ', '          Could use half a stick of butter instead. More habanero for flavor and use a mango instead of juice. ', "          I made this to serve with my air-fryer wings.  I used my own homegrown haba√±eros fresh from the freezer (it‚Äôs December). Let me say that I can eat these at Buffalo Wild Wings all day long, but I, nor anyone else present, couldn‚Äôt eat three wing sections without needing a cool down. I added a second can of mango nectar and reduced again. It‚Äôs still hot enough to make my entire face burn nicely for 15 or 20 minutes. I think it was my sun ripened peppers, compared to the commercially  grown variety that made it so intense. Next time I'll try the store bought peppers..Still gets 5 stars! ", '          Love it!! This is my favorite mango habanero wing recipe, even over the restaurants! We made this and left the seeds in.. definitely spicy but has a sweet kick. I love spicy so if you can‚Äôt handle you should remove the seeds. The corn starch gives it the crunch which I love! This is definitely my favorite and we have saved the recipe to keep making, so delicious!! ']

name: Mahi Mahi with Coconut Rice and Mango Salsa
comments: ['           Delicious and elevated‚Ä¶ so many levels of flavor, tantalizing the palate‚Ä¶But It‚Äôs supposed to have red bell peppers, red onions and cilantro in the salsa! ', "          Made this recipe without the mango (though it sounds really good) as it was a last minute dinner and I didn't have mangos.  Served it with a cucumber salad dressed with rice vinegar.  Added some cilantro (as I had some on hand), chopped, to the rice for color and toasted some coconut flakes to mix into the rice.  I got raves - particularly on the rice.  It made a beautiful presentation and was SO QUICK AND EASY.  Be advised, it makes a lot of rice - I could have easily cut back by half and still had plenty. ", '          Excellent!  I did not cook the mango, just chopped it & used it fresh. ', '          I couldn‚Äôt get fresh mango, so I mixed some commercial mango salsa with chopped frozen mango and reduced the sugar in the ‚Äúsalsa‚Äù part of the recipe. Other than that, I followed the recipe as written. Watch the cooking time on broiling the fish (might need to pull it sooner than indicated), but overall, this recipe is pretty simple and yield incredible flavor and texture. ', '           So good!!! ', '           Fantastic!!!  I cut the pepper flakes in half and might even cut it back a bit more but overall wonderful flavor from the marinade. Didn‚Äôt add any sugar to the rice and used a different salsa since I had it already. Will make this again. Makes a ton of rice ?? ', "          I didn't have mangos so i went with pineapple chunks in butter and brown sugar with 1/4 teaspoon of crushed red pepper flakes. The rice was cooked in one cup water and one cup chicken broth. ", '          Added orange pepper to the mango salsa. Used slightly unripe mango and it created a delicious salsa ', '          I don‚Äôt usually eat fish but this was INCREDIBLE! My family and in-laws loved it! I followed the recipe exactly  for the fish marinade - minus the red pepper flakes. I did add the avocado, red onion, lime cilantro as others suggested and it added incredible flavor to the meal and tied in nicely with the mango and yummy rice!  This is a keeper for sure..restaurant quality! ']

name: Mango Bread
comments: ['           Loved it added more coconut and nuts and let the mango sit to create juice just to give it a better mango flavor. It‚Äôs delicious ', '          My family loved his bread. I‚Äôve made it multiple times. The second time used extra large eggs and I doubled the coconut and it was perfect. I also melted the butter and then let it cool.  The flavor depends on the quality of the mangoes. ', "          Yum!  Our neighbor keeps giving us mangoes, so I keep making this bread!  I doubled it, and used 1 1/3 cup brown sugar, 1 cup white sugar, and I added two bananas to it.  Maybe next time I'll only add 3/4 cup white sugar; it was pretty sweet!  Very delicious! ", '           This was so moist and tasty.I used one 8x4x2 pan and two small ones, the small ones got done 10 minutes sooner than the larger pan. I followed the re pie as is. ', '          No leftovers. A good sign as any that says the recipe for this mango bread works. Thanks for sharing.Next time may tweak this recipe with some suggestions by commenters. ', '          This is my husband‚Äôs and my favorite. My wonderful neighbor would supply the mangos and I made bread for his family as well. Here are some adjustments I have made: Butter - 1/2 cup +1/4 cup coconut oilSugar-2/3 cup brown and 2/3 cup whiteUse unsweetened coconut. ', '          I used almond cassava flour blend and organic cane sugar üòç ', '           A friend called this the best mango bread she has ever eaten. I was pleasantly surprised at how well this turned out. There are walnut haters in my household so I left the nuts out. The honey mango and coconut alone tasted great. I made these into mango muffins and cooked for about 25 minutes at altitude. Another friend asked me to make this again soon and I just might. ', '          It only made 1 loaf and halfSo I used  2 mini.loaf for remaing batter.Mango bread is delish. Second time making it. ']

name: White Peachy Sangria
comments: ['          This was tasty and fun.  We used frozen fruit mix of mangos, pineapples, peaches and strawberries, and it turned out well.   We mixed it the evening before, but waited to add the Sprite until right before we served it.  In hindsight, we should have listened to the author and mixed it all together to rest overnight.  It was definitely better the 2nd day, with the flavors having had time to meld and the Sprite to blend. ', "          We made this to go with our Mexican themed dinner with friends.  It was a huge hit!  Since peaches weren't in season, we added raspberries, pears and strawberries.  It was tasty and easy to make.  I will definitely make this again. ", '          I brought it to a family gathering and it was a huge hit! ', '          Love this and I get two treats out of it! ', '          I always run out and the dispenser is in the air while the last few guests are trying to get the last drop. It‚Äôs a big hit. ', '          I used 2 bottles of moscato, 1/2 cup of peach brandy, and 1/4 cup peach schnapps. It was a big hit! ', '          This recipe is amazing! Everyone LOVES it when I bring this sangria to the BBQ. First Sangria I ever made, super easy, I used Cavit Moscato wine, and it was perfect! ', '          This was delicious and loved by all. I made a couple changes. I used apricot brandy and Pinot Grigio.   It is a very versatile sangria and could be changed to your taste. ', '          This tastes like summer in your mouth! Especially great for an outdoor party! It was delicious. I didn‚Äôt use the full measure of peach schnapps based on other reviews. And just upped my fresh peaches. This was a big hit. Definitely a keeper. ']

name: Maui Girl's Mango Pie
comments: ["           Everyone in my family really liked the pie but you didn't really taste the mango. They said it just tasted like really good pie but has no distinct flavor. ", '           I made this recipe and made one of the adjustment. I put a half a cup of shredded coconut for texture and for tropical taste. My husband was absolutely in love with his pie.? ', '          I‚Äôve made this pie 5 times already in July as everyone who tried it wanted more. ', '          Good recipe. I used half of the cinnamon and was glad I did. Next time I‚Äôll cut back on the cornstarch...1 tbsp would probably be enough. ', "          loved the pie several times now.    My last iteration I added 1/8 teaspoon each of nutmeg and cloves.  Really made the flavor pop!   I'm in Kenya, where mangos are between ten and thirty cents each while apples are hard to get. ", '          Reduced sugar to 1/4 cup. Made a Crisco crust recipe, 2/3 Crisco and 1/3 butter. Turned out d__n near perfect.', '          Wonderful recipe with some adjustments - I did a mix of 2/3 mango and 1/3 peach since both of them were in season at the time.   Changed the 1/2 cup white sugar to half and half brown sugar to white sugar and doubled the cinnamon.  Also added a tablespoon of vanilla.  For the pie crust I made Ruth‚Äôs Grandma‚Äôs pie crust recipe from this site.  After a simple egg wash with sugar sprinkle on top it baked up beautifully - and was a complete hit. ', "          The pie was AWESOME!! Everyone in my family loved it. I made mini pies (the size of cupcakes) and the only thing I changed was I didn't use any cornstarch, but it still turned out perfect. ", '           Absolutely awesome ran out of crusts for the top (4 store bought). Be careful about the amount of sugar start a little less and adjust to taste.  Used a crumble recipe that I tweaked (https://www.crazyforcrust.com/how-to-make-crumble-topping-for-fruit-pies/)  12  tbsp/170g butter, 2/3 cup/132 g of  brown sugar, 1 and 1/2 cups 180g of flour and 1/2 tbsp/4g of cinnamon (doubled it for the four pies). melt in your mouth good. my oven is spot on temperature wise so while I started the pies at 400f after 15 min I dropped the temperature to 350f. some pie requires ice cream this one the ice cream detracts from the desert. ']

name: Healthy Fish Tacos with Mango Salsa
comments: ['          This salsa is AMAZINGLY tasty.  I substituted the ACV with Balsalmic Vinegar only because I was out.  We are not even "healthy" eaters necessarily, just had some ripe mangos that needed to be eaten and love fish tacos.  The only negative feedback was from my 22 year-old son who thought it was too sweet (he douses everything with habanero).  His loss -- the rest of us gobbled it up on the fish and with tortilla chips! ', "           The salsa was SO good! I only made half a batch, which was enough for the fish,  but if you want plenty leftover for chips, make all of it. The only change I made for the salsa was to cut the brown sugar in half, and it was perfect. The seasoning for the fish didn't sound very good to me, so I used homemade fajita seasoning instead. The cooking method was perfect. I didn't serve as a taco, but just put the salsa over the fish. I will make this again! ", '          The mango salsa is the star of the dish.  I did add cilantro to the salsa.  I also baked tilapia with a mexican spice rub, only as I prefer my fish baked. ', '          This was SO good!  Amazed at the flavor in the salsa.  Ended up being low on fish for the tacos so we could only have one.  Going to try the leftover salsa on some shredded chicken, but this is definitely a do-over dish. ', '          Just delicious ', '          I needed a recipe for mahi-mahi which was on sale.  I made the salsa as the recipe said except that I used dried parsley flakes. I ended up just serving it on the pieces of grilled fish as I had no tortillas.  It was delicious, my husband really liked it, and I will make it again. ', '          I swapped out fish for chicken because I personally don‚Äôt like fish that much and this was just fantastic!!! I have been eating the salsa with chips all the time and it‚Äôs delicious! definitely will make again! ', '          This was so good! ', "          This salsa is so good. The only thing I changed was the red onion, not a fan otherwise so yummy. I've also made it with some fresh cod my husband brought home. It was even better than the mahi. "]

name: Sweet and Kickin' Mango-Habanero Hot Sauce
comments: ["           I made this for the sole purpose of sauce for chicken wings. I think it would be too sweet to just dip chips in but it was excellent as a wing sauce. The habanero's I used were pickled in a jar so I'm not sure if that made any difference heat wise . You get the sweet at first and then the heat comes in from behind. It was spicy, yes but that is what habanero's do best. "]

name: Lela's Protein Mango Smoothie
comments: ['           Enjoyed this nicely flavored smoothie. I made it exactly as recipe specified (without honey) and it was delicious. This will be my go-to protein shake. ', '          It was absolutely delicious! My kids said it was the best smoothie ever! ', '          Love it. ', '           Nice balance of flavors.  I used coconut yogurt. ', '          this smoothy was delicious but I feel like the mango flavor was kinda washed out other than that though it was a delicious smoothy ', '          I used coconut cream and milk instead of yogurt and almond milk, and used vanilla extract instead of protein powder.  It was pretty good, and made a tasty, filling breakfast, although, even when I added more mango, It lacked some flavor. ', '          I was just looking to make a mango smoothie without the protein, so I took out the protein powder and the smoothie still taste great! ', "           My kids said this was the best smoothie they've ever had. Thank you Lela!! ", '          Perfect .... thank u! ']

name: Spicy Mango Sauce
comments: ['          Makes a very nice sauce to go with baked fish.  I baked a cut of Dugso, a fish common to the Philippines.  Combines very well.  I have also used apple to make this instead of mango, also very food. ', "          Absolutely delicious!  Couldn't find a Thai chili pepper so I sub'd 1/4 of a habenero.  Otherwise, I followed recipe exactly. ", '          Loved this relatively simple recipe that is so versatile and becomes the centerpiece of the meal. Used it on grilled halibut first night, grilled salmon the next and just ate the remainder straight out of the bowl with a spoon. I coated the fish with olive oil and a sprinkle of chili powder before grilling which complemented the mango sauce nicely. I could not find the Thai pepper so I used a Serrano and left about half of the seeds/membrane in to make sure there was enough kick. That seemed to work perfectly. ', "          A real crowd pleaser. I should have made more. Chef John's video is definitely helpful as usual. Made the recipe as written. Had to go to a local Asian grocery to find the Thai chili pepper. Served with pork tenderloin and shrimp appetizers cooked on the Big Green Egg. ", '          This was very tasty and easy! Letting it sit helped the flavors a lot ', "          I have a mango tree and mangoes are falling like there is no tomorrow. So, I searched up mango sauce and this was the first recipe to come out. This is so delish!!! I had to change it up a little since I didn't have all the ingredients. I had unseasoned rice vinegar which I seasoned with Italian seasoning. Then I added Thai chili sauce, some red pepper flakes, the mango, green onions, cilantro, and lemon juice. OMG! So yummy! I think this would be a great combo with ceviche. Thank you for the great recipe! ", "           I just made it!! I used it as a marinade instead of just a sauce. I haven't cooked my fish yet but so far the mango sauce alone is so good ", '          It tastes great. American mangoes are a bit rubbish, but I was fairly pleased with the results I got rehydrating dried mangoes from the Philippines. One pack is just the right amount, I think.', '          Great over salmon! ']

name: Fresh Mango Salsa
comments: ['          Wonderful taste, no sugar is needed if your mangoes are ripe. I canned the extras, hopefully it tastes just as good as fresh made. ', '          I used this recipe to replace a package mix by Fresh Express. I added crushed pineapple and it was pretty close to my old mix. Best thing about this salsa is you can add all kinds of substitutes. ', '          Delicious! I added half a can of black beans, as well, and it was perfect! ', '           Yum yum yum! Great way to use up any tomatoes when you start getting the large crop towards the end of summer. Chop up your tomatoes and let them sit while your prepare the rest of the ingredients. Drain the excess juice from them and mix it all ', "          easy recipe, it's a winner ", '          Followed recipe as is... yum! ', "          Great recipe!
