It is true that a ripe papaya can make all the difference. Choose one that is mostly yellow, soft but not mushy, and heavy. Fresh ingredients are always best! I used basil, tomato and papaya from my garden. With these adjustments, it was wonderful! ", "          I HATE papaya, but we got some beautiful papayas as part of a Harry & David gift and I didn't want to waste them. This was surprisingly good! The tomato and vinegar offset the sweetness nicely. I recommend starting with no sugar, but add gradually to taste. I was also very unsure of what the papaya seeds would add-- I didn't know you could eat them. Our learning: yes, they're great as used here, but don't eat them alone! ;-) My daughter & I each crunched one before adding to the recipe. Don't try this at home. A little like crunching a black peppercorn. But in the blender as part of the dressing, they add a very unusual peppery flavor, like cracked pepper. For those who had problems with watery-ness: brush your baguette slices with a touch of olive oil (or spray lightly) and bake 5 min so they're good & crunchy, and definitely drain the salsa before spooning on. Thanks for a unique, light app that will be used several times this summer! ", "          This was really yummy.  I am going to rate it 5 stars even though I changed an ingredient (ok two). I didn't have any red wine vinegar so I used strawberry vinegrette and I used olive oil instead.  Even if I would have followed it, it would have been just as yummy- so try it! ", '          Excellent; I used half the sugar and drained before serving and it was perfect.  I halved the recipe and still had plenty for 8 people, unless this were a whole meal I think the portions are a bit off.  Would be great with mango too instead of the papaya. ', "          This is fabulous.  It bugs me when people rate recipes but have essentially changed the original, but I must admit that I subbed mango for the papaya because that's what I had.  It was wonderful on bread BUT the next day we had it with grilled salmon!  Amazing combination! "]

name: Tropical Island Fruit Salad
comments: ['          Delicious! I added strawberries and some shredded coconut for texture. A squeeze of lime and it was good!! ', "           Simple and delicious!  I like the addition of the banana. They balance out the tartness from the pineapple and mango.  I'm not normally a huge fan of papaya, but it's very good mixed with the other fruits. I think next time I might sprinkle some coconut over the top. Great recipe!"]

name: Pawpaw (Papaya) And Mango Punch
comments: ['           Delicious, not too sweet. The sweetness is just right! Refreshing, and smells good too. I used grapefruit zest. Give it a try! ', '          Amazing flavor, yet not overwhelming at all. Only used about half the amount of water called for. I put a scoop of vanilla ice cream in this and made creamcicle like floats. =^.^= Tasty. ', '           This is absolutely delicious! Great combination of fruits, very tropical. I increased the amount of fruit, used frozen mango, and only used 1/3 cup of water just because I prefer thick smoothies. No need to add any sugar. Thanks for the recipe! ']

name: Green Papaya Salad (Som Tam Malakor)
comments: ["          rating 3 stars because I don't know how to shred a green papaya easily. I need that procedure to make the recipe complete. ", '          This salad is delicious and just like they make it in HAWAII....  If you buy a papaya from the grocery store they usually are already having  color inside so if you have an Asian market nearby, ask for the papaya salad.... papaya because they will be green inside and what you want.  You can also buy a shredding tool that is less than $10.00 and it makes your salad perfect.  LOVE THIS RECIPE ']

name: Papaya Boats
comments: ['          Just followed directions. Refreshing great with hot or salty flavors. ', '          Wow, this is awesome!  I used Greek yogurt and really liked the mixture of the tart yogurt and sweet fruit.  This dish is also great for texture-- you get crunchy nuts, smooth yogurt, soft fruit, and chewy raisins.  Yum! ', '          Yum! I happened to have a small, ripe hawaiian papaya on hand along with greek yogurt. Put the nuts on top and it was great! ', "          This was a wonderful dish. Everyone in the family loved it. I make my own yogurt which isn't as thick as store bought so I diced up the papaya and poured the mixture over the top. I also didn't have any raisins so I used dried cranberries. I will be making this again!  ", '           I used a very lg papaya & served half of it to two people. I added a bit of vanilla to my yogurt & I used dried cherries instaed of raisins & fresh blueberries instead of strawberries. Wsa a very light & refreshing dessert...thansk for the recipe! Forgot to add that we grilled this for just long enough to get some cool grill marks. ', '          Its a very good alternative to a pineapple version. And very tasty too. I like this recipe alot! ']

name: Mango Papaya Fruit Salad
comments: ["           This is very similar to how we usually eat papaya (with lime juice and honey). The addition of balsamic vinegar scared me a bit, so I cut that back to just a sprinkle (probably more like 1 tsp). It wasn't that noticeable, so maybe it would have been fine with the entire amount, but I was afraid it would ruin it for us. I did add some toasted coconut on top, and garnished it with fresh mint. Very pretty and refreshing. I'd gladly serve this to dinner guests. "]

name: Mexican Green Papaya Salad
comments: ["          I was skeptical in making  this recipe.  Instead of  putting 1 cup of cold cooked corn and 1 red pepper. I bought frozen Birdseye - lightly seasoned southwestern corn bag (2/3 cup serving) and microwaved it. I let it cool down then did the recipe as it was written. It came out delicious. Make it, you won't regret it. ", '          Family of seven....not one liked it. ', "          I live near all of the ethnic markets listed above and couldn't find a green papaya so I diced up a ripe one. The brown sugar adds a nice touch to a great salad. "]

name: Papaya-Stuffed Chicken and Basmati Rice
comments: ['          Fantastic! ', '          I made some changes, but the chicken was very bland. Papaya is not a strong enough flavor to do all the work here.  If I made it again, I would definitely add salt and probably other spices. ', "          This was suprisingly delicious.  I went a lil heavy on cinn. and cayenne because I like a lil extra heat.  That cinn. was strong... oops.  Everything was perfectly timed and couldn't be happier.  Thanks for the recipe. ", "          I made the sauce to pour over drums and rice (because I didn't have breast on hand, and we are Gluten Free). The sauce was excellent. I didn't have nutmeg, so I added ginger instead of cinnamon and nutmeg. Still excellent, gave it a very tropical Pacific Islands flavor. I think it would even bee good with yellow curry. Great idea. ", "          What a super yummy dish!  I used butter instead of margarine, crushed red pepper flakes instead of cayenne and regular rice instead of basmati.  Other than these minor changes I followed the recipe.  It was very easy (I did use toothpicks to pin the chicken breasts shut).  It was a longer process than a normal dinner but worth it.  Full of wonderful flavors, I'm looking forward to leftovers! ", "          I picked some papaya from my new home's garden, and had no idea what to do with it.  Wonderful recipe, but the sauce was especially AMAZING!  Can't wait to make it again. ", '          Wonderful melding of sweet & savory.  We really liked it. ', '          Absolutely delish! We all loved it! I was out of nutmeg so I used allspice which gave it a nice "apple pie" flavour. The only complaint is the chicken is really difficult to cook after breading. I think next time I\'ll brown the chicken first and then immediately bread to see if that works better. ', '          This is right out of any classic Cuban cookbook.  The mixture of sweet and spicy is wonderful.  If you like this recipe, I urge you to look into Cuban cooking.  Its not firey hot like the rest of Carribean cooking and the flavors are fantastic. ']

name: Georgie's Mango Papaya Salad
comments: ['          Wow what a unique taste.  Put some chicken breast on top and made a fantastic quick meal. ', "          The first time I made it, I was in a hurry so I didn't candy the almonds. I was a great lunch salad. The second time, I did candy the almonds, and it does add to the salad. I decided it needed something else, so I added some chopped red onion and grape tomatoes. These additions made it even better. ", '          The flavors of this salad were amazing!  Great textures, especially enjoyed the candied almonds.  This will be a great accompaniment to grilled chicken in the future.   Thanks for sharing! ', '          This was so refreshing.  We had this as a side salad for dinner, but I could see this with a sandwich at lunch.  The "dressing" was an unexpected surprise.  I was concerned that it would have a strange taste, but the balsamic vinegar added just the right tartness to balance out sweetness of the fruit. ', "          Fantastic! I'm not a huge fan of either mango or papaya, but this blew me away! ", "          Fantastic! I'm not a huge fan of either mango or papaya, but this blew me away! ", "          This isn't just a side salad, as yes, it could be. It can also be a hot summer day meal, a desert, or a tasty snack. When canding almonds always stir through the whole cooking time, then they won't burn. I thought this was good enough to put on my new resturant menu. Koodoo's to the cook! ", "          This was very healthy and light and decent, but not spectacular.  I figure that the salad is only as good as the ripeness of the fruits.  Unusual combination of fruits though, considering avocado season is in the winter, so I couldn't get all my fruits ripe at the same time.  I candied almonds using only white sugar and heating them in a NONSTICK pan (very important). Then I let them cool on GREASED wax paper.  Not sure I'll make this salad again.  ", '          I really wanted to like this.  And it was good.  However, "sugaring" the almonds was tricky, burnt them on the first try. watch the amount of butter.  also the dressing, though good, is heavy. do NOT put on until just before serving. after that, doesn\'t take long for the fruits to turn into mush. also the prep time on this has got to be wrong. 15 minutes? took me that long to do the mango and papaya and get them in the blender for the dressing.  55 minutes, although I did use an extra mango. still way off. I gave it 3 stars because it took too long, was expensive and not a light summer salad as I thought. ']

name: Thai-Inspired Confetti Salad
comments: ['          I have made this twice now and my husband and I both really like it.  I do believe I will blanch the green beans and maybe try it with some peanut butter in the sauce.  I served it with blackened tuna and we both thought it went very well together. ', "          Excellent - I couldn't stop eating it, thanks for sharing. I look forward to making it with varied fruits. ", "          I was really surprised how well I liked this simple salad.  My BF on the other hand wouldn't want to eat it again ever ", "          TRY THIS!!  Not sure what made me since it is so unusual, perhaps that I was making south beach coconut chicken and they seemed to make sense together.  But when it came time to make and eat it we were really nervous.  It was delicious!!  So fresh and flavorful.  Not sure what fish sauce is (I am the sister of a chef, so I get to be all kinds of ignorant when it comes to food since that is her job!), but it is not what I thought it was, i.e. strongly fishy tasting.  Only change I made was to blanch the green beans for a few minutes before putting them in ice water.  Just didn't want raw green beans - call me wimpy if you want.  My papaya seemed to be from Mexico and was pinker than the one in the picture, if that matters.  Luscious, luscious, luscious and ridiculously healthful.  Thanks taddy, will be making again and again. (Oh, and it did actually go great with the SB coconut chicken) ", '          Wonderful veggie salad ', '          This was so yummy!  We just got back from Thailand and loved all the great food.  I added mango instead of papaya (taste preference) and I also added sweet red peppers and used cashews because that was all I had.  I cannot stop eating this salad!  Thanks for the great recipe. ', "          Very nice sauce.  I'm sorry to say it turns out I don't like papaya, but that's not your fault!  I love mango though so will try with that next time. ", '          I make this salad very often these days. Instead of cubing the papayas though, I slice it very thinly. Also, I add chunky peanut butter to the sauce which gives incredible rich peanut flavor! ', '           Light, refreshing and very colorful. I subbed mango for the papaya due to personal preference, and like others, I blanched the green beans. I thought there was a little something missing flavor-wise - maybe some ginger? - but all in all it was pretty good! ']

name: Baby Back Ribs with Papaya Sauce
comments: ['          the  title says " spicy", but we found it rather bland.. not sure if the recipe is missing something. we added 1 Tbs of Liquid Smoke, which really brought out the papaya flavor and added the rest of the papaya. we also used country ribs, which cooked faster than the 1 1/2 hrs. my son was not impressed but my husbamd ans I enjoyed it, but not sure I would make it again ', '          I thought this was just ok; my husband enjoy it more then I did. I would not make it again sorry to say.  ', '          I love spice. It runs through my family. THIS TASTE SO GOOD!! :D ']

name: Papaya Passion Smoothie
comments: ["          I have been looking for a smoothie recipe to use my papaya in and this is my favorite.  I love this.  I had to make 2 changes because I didn't have condensed milk or vanilla yogurt.  I used plain yogurt instead and used 1 1/2 cups milk and 1/2 cup whipping cream. ", "           I was a bit hesitant to try this smoothie after seeing the other review, but actually think it's quite tasty and refreshing.  I did not make it exactly as the recipe, however,  I did not use the sweetened condensed milk because I do not care for the taste unless it's in a baked product, nor did I use the cream cheese.  I used Del Monte SunFresh papaya (jarred), whole milk, plain yogurt, vanilla extract, lime juice and honey.  I would make this smoothie again with my changes.  Thank you for the new idea for using papaya! ", '          I did not care for this smoothie. ']

name: Watermelon Fish Snack for Kids
comments: ["           Super cute! I did not have papaya but used pineapple for the fin and cantaloupe for the mouth (you can barely see in the photo). You can use any fruit your kid will eat. My grumpy daughter who claimed she wasn't hungry immediately gobbled it up when she saw it. "]

name: Cobb Salad
comments: ['          Loved it! SO easy to make too!! ', '          Delicious and very filling ', '          Perfection. ', '          Made this for my parents. we all really enjoyed it! ', '          Turned out really good substitute of the blue cheese for feta and served with sliced cherry tomatoes to ', "          I switched Iceberg for Spinach and Romaine.  The rest of the ingredients weren't bad ", '          Easier way to make bacon: ', '          Made this with the exception of blue cheese (used cheddar instead). ', '          I made this salad as directed, except for the avocado. It‚Äôs winter time now in Michigan, so I couldn‚Äôt get a decent one if I tried. I also made my own ranch dressing from the site, the Ranch Dressing ll. This was really good and just what I was craving. Thanks for putting the recipe together! ']

name: Avocado Breakfast Sandwich
comments: ['          Simple yet tasty ', '          Good concept but a little bland. I agree needs something to make it pop. And very messy to eat so next time - when experimenting with seasonings - will slightly mash the avocado to make a better ‚Äúbed‚Äù for the egg. I like this idea! Will make again with some tweaks. Thanks Tricia for some new breakfast inspiration. ', '          What a hit for our Easter Sunday breakfast! Easy to make as directed,  If made for just husband and I, would use only one egg. ', '           I usually don‚Äôt like avocado, but this sandwich  tastes delicious. I only had mozarela cheese, it‚Äôs what I used. ', '          Loved it! The teenager loves it as well. I‚Äôve made it with one and two eggs and used whatever cheese is in the fridge. Also another great way to eat avocado. Thanks for the recipe!! ', '          The recipe is great but I made a couple changes for our tastes. I changed to only 1 egg and I added a strip of thick bacon cut in half so there were 2 rows of bacon. When removing the fried egg from the pan I placed it on the cooked bacon so it was easy to pickup and put on top of the Swiss cheese. Delicious breakfast and so easy to make. ', '          Excellent sandwich and filling as well! The subtle blend of flavors made this  5-star restaurant possibility! ', "          i used an English muffin instead of bread, which wasn't the greatest idea, and its hard to cut/eat, but still very tasty and will try again with whole grain bread, thx:", '          Made the eggs over easy, and substituted white cheddar and muenster cheeses. Also used white bread. Came out delicious, if a bit messy to flip and to eat! ']

name: Seven-Layer Dip
comments: ['          This recipe is really good and has bright flavors. So good! ', '          I make this often and always switch it up. My family loves it. ', '          Always a  hit.  I like this version because the taco seasoning is mixed into the sour cream. ', '          I made this for an after work get together. There wasn‚Äôt any left. Super easy to make. Definitely a keeper. ', '          Followed exactly and this is the best! We all loved it. ', '          Beautiful ', '          My family and I loved it! We used greek yogurt, instead of sour cream, and green olives since those are what we had on hand and it was still SUPER TASTY! Thank you for the recipe! ', "          It was great even though I didn't have the ripest avocados.  Next time I'll make sure to shop better.  I also added diced red onions and jalapenos to the veggies on top.  Very good! ", '          Everyone loved it!  My favorite 7 layer dip that I have made.  I forgot to buy taco seasoning, so I had to make my own.  This was delicious! ']

name: Avocado Smoothie
comments: ['           I made this recipe exactly as written and loved it.  This smooth, creamy smoothie has a sweet taste despite the savory flavor of the avocado.  One could easily mistake this smoothie for a dessert.  If your kids like the individual ingredients and can get past the light green color, like my son did, they will enjoy this, too. ', '           Delicious, creamy, and refreshing ', '          I love this smoothie, I did add some lemon and lime juice and a little agava longside the honey. ', '          Replaced honey a with a frozen banana for sweeting (like I saw in another recipe) and added some spinach to the mix. It was delicious. Everybody at home liked it. I wish I had done more. ', '          Omgggg this was sooo good. I followed the recipe exactly and it‚Äôs soooooo creamy. It took a short time to make and I def recommend it. ', '          Instead of milk, I used coconut milk and half the amount of honey. Very yummy and now also vegan. ', "           I thought it was good but I couldn't really taste the avacado. I would have liked to taste the avacado in it too ", "          Waaay too much honey and not sure the vanilla yogurt helped. Didn't at all taste very much of avocado. Will not be making this one again. ", '          Really delicious! Perfect amount of yogurt. Next time, I will probably only do 2 tbsp of honey (too sweet for me). I also added some quick oats to give it some texture. ']

name: Homemade Sushi
comments: ['          delishus ', '          i love this sushi! ', '          Even though the mat-rolling part was a bit difficult, it was fun and delicious! ', "           This Sushi Roll recipe is too die for. I was really impressed. It was AMAZING!!! honestly, if you haven't tried this recipe you have to it is the best. It was really simple and easy instructions. ", '          Good ', '          making sushi is fun and not very hard ', '          Great recipe, thank you! ', '          amazing! ', "          I've never made sushi before and this is an excellent recipe. I had no idea there is rice vinegar, sugar and salt mixed with the rice. We used avocado, cucumber, mango, shrimp and imitation crab to make a variety of rolls. I'll try adding cream cheese and thin carrot sticks in the future. My only issue was that there was not enough rice for 4 nori sheets. Other recipes also mention to leave a 1/2'' gap at the top of the nori sheet to help with rolling it up, which I will try next time. Great recipe and the family loved them. "]

name: Avocado Salad
comments: ["          This is basically chunky guacamole, but still good. Unless you use jumbo avocados I think the amount of onion and bell would still be too much and take away from the avocado, so just add what you like. I used red onion and an orange bell because Hubbs isn't a fan of green. For us, extra cilantro always! I had leftover grilled corn so threw that in as well. Great salad, used the leftovers on breakfast tacos! ", '          I love this salad! I double it. I add 4 ears of fresh corn, cut off the cob. A jalape√±o if I have one, red pepper instead of green, a container of cherry tomatoes, and a little minced garlic. Heavy on the cilantro. Delicious. ', '           Delicious, fresh salad. I love the blend of the avocado and tomato, with some zest from the onion. ', '          Scrumptious summer side dish, also delicious as the topping on crusty bread/bruschetta. ', '          My husband loved this! ', '          Delicious as side with chips to chicken tomatillo enchiladas. I used jalape√±os because that‚Äôs the pepper I use. Will continue with this in dinner rotations. Scrumptious! ', '           I can get on board with any "no measurements required" recipe.  For a salad for one, and using what I had, I used one avocado, half a red onion, a handful of cherry tomatoes, juice from half a lime, bit of yellow pepper, a good splash of olive oil, S&P, and I added some crumbled feta, because cheese.  DELICIOUS. ', '           yummy fresh and light. I did make a few changes, used a poblano instead of green pepper, added a small English Cucumber sliced, used about 10 cherry/grape tomatoes of different colors, love cilantro and used it fresh from my garden,used a whole avocado and 2 tbsp of lime juice. ', '          This salad is so refreshing, I used cherry tomatoes and was even more delicious, I mad it for the fourth time now ']

name: Chocolate Avocado Pudding
comments: ['          Used maple syrup instead of sugar and added a little coconut oil to help mask the "green" flavor. Melted dark chocolate and poured over and let it harden. Added a raspberry as a topper. Delish. ', '          the negative reviews are probably from ripe avocados. Mine were pre-ripe but soft enough to handle and were tasteless in the recipe.  I used 2 T stevia instead of sugar, dark chocolate powder and it was awesome! ', "          My wife and I decided we won't make any other kind of chocolate pudding. It is amazing! Also is great way to get omegas down our kids that refuse avocados because of the texture.After reading through some of the reviews it is obvious you need to be very careful about the ripeness of the avocados you use. An underripe or hard avocado will produce a grainy texture and funny taste. Ripe avocados (just gives slightly when squeezed) come out smooth with only a slight avocado flavor.We also used a higher quality coconut milk that we save to make curry with, that could also affect the end flavor because the milk is not super sweet but has a pleasant coconut flavor and mild smell. It also solidifies quickly and smoothly when chilled which would help the texture and how well this pudding sets up when refrigerated.Definitely needs to be well blended, but when done, it is perfection!The serving size seems a bit off too. Says it makes 4 servings. We found it to be so rich and satisfying that we figured it to be closer to 6 or 8 serving per batch if you can manage to stay out of it! ", '          Incredible! Tasted like rich dark chocolate pudding. Will make again every time I have extra avocados getting too ripe. I increased vanilla and added almond extract and left out the cinnamon. I will have to try the cinnamon version one of these days.üòçüòçüòç. ', '          I only had about 1/2 an avacado so I made a much reduced recipe. I blended it for a long time and it was super smooth. ', '           OMG!! THIS IS SO FREAKING GOOD I AM EATING IT RIGHT NOW!! YOU HAVE GOT TO TRY THIS THE T ASTE IS AMAZING!!!I STRAINED IT IN AN ICING  STRAINER TO MAKE IT SMOOTHER ', '          Ended up with grainy paste that tastes like ur eating grass uck ', '          nice. its delicious ', '          We loved it! I doubled the recipe and found it needed an entire can of coconut milk. ']

name: Traditional Mexican Guacamole
comments: ["          This was so easy to make and so good!  I didn't have any tomatoes so I added a can of diced tomato and green chili. ", '          I really like this recipe. It‚Äôs so easy, but so authentic. Make it all the time!üëç ', '           Only thing I would suggest is to refrigerate for 2 hours we ate before refrigerating and then after and was definitely different for the best ', "          It's quite good and was easy to make! Great for dipping chips. ", '           Excellent. Great taste. NO SALT added due to my restrictions. I added garlic 3 cloves. ', '          Great recipe ! I usually make it on a stone mortar and pestle and I swear it tastes better ', '          it tasted good and was easy to make ', "          The recipe was so good my sister and my mom made it together, it wasn't even that spicy i couldn't taste the jalapeno. Awesome recipe :) ", "          The only thing I might would change, is a little less lemon juice. Otherwise,  it's absolutely delicious! "]

name: Mexican Chicken Soup
comments: ['          Not enough spice for true "Mexican" soup - needs peppers such as Habanero or Jalepeno, also missing lime juice ', '          This was excellent!!  I also added corn I took from two corn on the cob and added them with the chicken for the last 5 minutes.  So yum. ', '          My family loved it ', '          Great soup! I added black beans, about a cup of salsa and a dab of sour cream on the top when serving. Yum. ', '          This was verry good everyone except my granddaughter loved it I did make a few changes I only added a teaspoon of cumin and I added black beans and green chiles ', '          With a few modifications, this is a delicious soup.  Our family likes mild soup, so I made the following changes:  I sauted onion & celery in 2 T butter and added 2 teaspoons taco seasoning and no other spices.     I added one 14 oz  can of diced tomatoes, one 6 oz can of tomatoes  with green chiles, one can of kidney beans, one can of pinto beans, and one can of hominy in addition to the frozen corn and 48 oz chicken broth.  (I drained & rinsed all canned items prior to adding them.)  Then,  I simmered that for 20 -30 minutes and finally added rotisserie chicken that I shredded. ', '          Added a can of red kidney beans. My whole family loved it ', '          If you  like savory soups, this one is for you!! ', '           Hi added extra avocado, extra cilantro and a little bit of lime?.  I also used a bit of fajita seasoning in addition to taco seasoning. ']

name: Roquefort Pear Salad
comments: ["          Loved it. Subbed honey for sugar and didn't caramelize pecans. Everyone that I've shared it with loves it too. ", '           FabEverything was amazing. ', '          This salad is delicious!  Our new favorite salad. Ripe D Anjou pears are really good in this salad.  Made it with original blue cheese (our favorite).  Made the pecans as directed, excellent.  Will use the pecans in other salads too.  Couldn‚Äôt stop munching on them. ', '          Amazing. Made exactly as recipe stated. This got rave reviews from my very picky girlfriends at our annual holiday dinner. The dressing is what really makes it. Will be making for my family Christmas dinner. Thank you for sharing! ', '          Absolute favorite!! I‚Äôve made & shared many times, people always love it.I often omit the cheese to make it vegan/ plant based for myself. ', '           I loved this salad! The flavors were absolutely perfect blended together. Yummy!!! ', "          Wow, the combination of flavors in this salad is amazing, especially with the dressing!  I made it without cooking the pecans in sugar and it's still delicious!  I will definitely be making this again. ", '          I‚Äôve make this salad every Thanksgiving by my family‚Äôs request. I use a spring mix salad and substitute the yellow mustard for Dijon mustard. I never caramelize the pecans, just use them raw. Everyone loves it! Thanks for the recipe! ', '          Excellent recipe!!  Love it!!! ']

name: Banana, Avocado, and Spinach Smoothie
comments: ['          Not bad, but found it a little bland with milk, I used Orange juice instead ', '           Amazed how nice this actually was, half a tspoon more honey for me. Will be making again ', "          Fully satisfying, I used Nancy's unflavored yogurt, piece of fresh ginger, banana, pineapple, avocado and spinach. Touch of honey, super yummy. ", '          Amazing!!! ', '          Just happened to have the ingredients. Used vanilla almond milk which made it nuttier and a bit sweeter. Sooo easy. Sooo good. ', '          Very creamy and smooth.  I used Vanilla Almond Milk but did not add Honey.  The milk and the banana was sweet enough. ', '          I substituted almond milk, but everything else was to the letter.  I also added a teaspoon of moringa powder, which if anything, will make a smoothie taste worse, and this tasted very good WITH the moringa powder.  That means this smoothie is really good! ', '           Smooth and tasty! We tried some other smoothie recipes but this is superior. Followed the recipe but I could see subbing almond milk. ', '          This was the first time I‚Äôve ever had a smoothie that included avocado and it was incredible! So creamy! ']

name: Paleo Baked Eggs in Avocado
comments: ['          This is a great way to add healthy avocado to your diet. I just use half an avocado because that is plenty.  Of course you can adjust it with different spices etc. But I like a described and the idea gets 5 stars from me. ', '          Yummy üòãScooped and mashed the flesh, Then altered it slightly in that I‚Äôd seasoned and squeezed lime juice onto the scooped flesh which I mashedPut a couple of thinly sliced pieces of garlic into the flesh which is now returned to the skins, along with some sliced chilli.Made a well in the mashed flesh, added egg and again squeezed with lime juice and seasoned the top of the egg againUsed a microwave for 90seconds, which can be adjusted to avoid snotty whites and both the taste and texture was sumptuous. You can add bacon on top aswell but don‚Äôt season a second time with salt as it‚Äôs too much ', '          First, be sure to use size small eggs-otherwise you will need to scoop out so much avocado. ', '          Pretty good! I did it in the airfryer since it was only for me. only do for 10 mins if you want your eggs runny. Also I added some bacon and it was perfect. Love it ! ', "          I didn't grow up eating avocados but, as an adult, have acquired a taste for slices on sandwiches and guacamole with chips. I really thought this would be great, but discovered I don't care for warm avocados. A disappointing discovery about myself. ", "          I skipped the chives & bacon, since I didn't have them,  topping with tarragon & paprika instead. Very tasty. ", '           Fast and easy. I added a quick 2 minute broil to the end to finish the eggs. ', '          We didn‚Äôt care for it.  No taste for us, but others may enjoy it. ', "          I've made this a few times and both my wife and I agree that it's pretty good.  BUT!  I have to agree with some of the other reviewers that it is a  bit lacking in the flavor test.  So, I changed it up just a bit and  we both agree that it really is a terrific upgrade.  Here is what I did --"]

name: Cucumber and Avocado Sushi
comments: ['          My family loves this recipe ', '          This recipe is amazing and my children loved it. ', '          I‚Äôm allergic to all things fish and shellfish so I was so happy at our favorite japanese place I found out they had these and even happier when I tried them and they were amazing. These were just as good. I put more filling than instructed but not so much it would break. It looked more like the ones I get there. ', '          Love this roll. very easy. ', '          Half the amount of rice vinegar', '          I added in some carrot shreds, as well as some sugar snap peas, and it was delicious! ', "           I made this sushi and it was fabulous! I didn't have sushi rice OR rice vinegar. Instead, I used regular white rice and white vinegar and the sushi rolls turned out just fine; I loved them. I will make these again! I'm a vegetarian, my parents aren't so I did add imitation crab to half of my sushi batch for my parents. I also noticed that I didn't have enough rice cooked for 4 sheets of nori to be filled and the last one wasn't fully stuffed like the others. Next time, I'll make more rice! Overall, I love this so so much!! ", '          YUMMY!!!!!! My sister and I made these with Perfect Sushi Rice from this site. We did 2 California Rolls...with the imatation crab, cucumber (we used an English cuke), avacado. We also did 2 rolls with fresh Yellowfin Tuna from the fish dept. of our food store. This tuna was so fresh and mild...tasted like butter. Excellent! The tuna rolls we also added the cukes and avacado. We found our Nori seaweed in the Asian section of our food store....no problem. Served with wasabi and low sodium soy. Also made Japanese Soup with Tofu and Mushooms from this site and Vegetarian Dumplings from Alton Brown on Food Network for a complete meal. Thanks! ', "          I agree with others here, I felt intimidated about making sushi until I saw this recipe and decided to go for it. It is super easy! I marinated my cucumber in soy sauce, rice vinegar, and fresh ginger. I also added tofu. And embarrassingly, cream cheese! Ok, I'm white, I like cream cheese in my sushi! :) "]

name: Honduran Baleadas
comments: ['           If your tortilla comes out sticky add more flower the recipe did not add enough. ', '          es lo mas delicioso en la vida', '           I added about an extra cup and half of flour and worked the dough balls into their shape with floured hands and counter. ', '          Very yummy.i had it with a beer sitting on my front porch, it was yum ;) ', '          es lo que me queda coriendo en vida ', "          Maybe I'm just an idiot, but I put the ingredients and the correct measurements in for the dough and it turned into a liquid. I had to add two extra cups of flour before it even came close to being solid enough to work with. Not really impressed with this recipe ", '          I‚Äôve been trying to make these for so long and I couldn‚Äôt. I used hot sauce and husband topped with salsa verse. He loved it and I think kids would enjoy it too. ', '           It came out great, and I agree with other posters with it needing at least 2 more cups of flour for the tortillas to take form. ']

name: Mexican Shrimp Cocktail
comments: ['          I have had better cooked by the lime and lemon ', '          Made exactly as written. It was a hit with everyone!  Thank you so much!  This will be my new potluck addition. ', '          I always get this when I go to Mexican restaurant - I had no idea it was so easy to make!   Next time I\'m going to try it with scallops.  I don\'t serve it with saltines - I bake my own "cips" from naan  in the oven.  I like a softer chip. ', '           SOOO GOOD!!! I used all the ingredients except for horseradish since I didn‚Äôt have it on hand.  I also added tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, Serrano chili‚Äôs and sriracha and lots more clamato.  You won‚Äôt regret trying this one!! ', "           My husband loved it! Said it was better than a restaurant's. I didn't change anything. I think it came out great. ", '          This was a Delicious recipe, except I added 3 cucumber. A dash of Valentina.I also added a dash of Worcester sauce to mine. It was amazing. I use to work in a Mexican restaurant and there secret ingredient was Orange Fanta soda, crazy right? Maybe that was why it was so addictive to consume. ', '          This was delicious.  The only change that I made was that I used a spicy Bloody Mary mix rather than Clamato juice.  It was the perfect meal on a hot, humid summer day. ', '          Super tasty and easy! Thanks for sharing! ', "           I remember having this in the little fishing village of San Felipe in Baja, California Norte, Mexico in the early 1960's. It took me right back to the beach! I will definitely make it again. "]

name: Simple Avocado Milkshake
comments: ["          I didn't care for it because it really IS NOT sweet as you'd think! I made a double & wish I'd not. :/I make smoothies all the time & adding strawberries didn't help.Bland! ", '          It was really good and really nutritious. Loved it!!! ', '          I added 3/4 cup of milk because I think it would be too watery for me, personal preference. Wayy too sweet, would recommend to put one tablespoon first and adjust to preference. First time i made it it was so sweet that i can barely taste the avocado. However,overall, great recipe !! Thank you for the great recipe!! ', "          I used a frozen banana and cashew milk.  I didn't measure anything, just kind of dumped the ingredients in the blender. ", "          It's okay. Great for St. Patty's Day. ", "          This is a great 'Run out of the door' kind of shake!! I've made it more times than I can count, I use either Cashew or Coconut milk unsweetened and no honey and still enjoy!! ", '          This recipe was delicious are used one avocado and one frozen banana and filled up enough Allmond milk to make one cup and only 1 teaspoon of honey perfect ', '          Very tasty but a bit too sweet for me. My banana was frozen and I substituted coconut milk for the regular milk. I think next time I will cut back on the honey. I should have known better since I always wait until my bananas are more black than yellow when I freeze them. ', '          Yummy. Even my picky son loved it! Add chia seeds to it for more protein. ']

name: Avocado Tomatillo Salsa
comments: ['           This runs a close second and even better than any Tex mex restaurants around me!  This has become a household favorite any time we do Mexican food.  I took some of the others comments to add a little onion & garlic.  I also juice the half of  lime in a separate glass & add sparingly as I‚Äôm mixing because it can be too much lime with a half squeezed lime otherwise & it does take away from it.  I grow tomatillos in my spring & fall garden & never waste any of them (or give any away)now that I found this recipe! ', '          It‚Äôs excellent just as it is, but of course we all have our taste preferences. I added some garlic. I usually quadruple the recipe because my family eats it so fast. This tastes exactly like the tomatillo salsa at Los Cabos in Jenks, Oklahoma. ', '          Loved the creaminess the avocado brought, super good! I cut the Serrano into less than half and there was still a nice slow burn. ', "          I used jalapenos and omitted the cilantro and it was delicious. Put it on roast beef sliders and use on nachos chips. Can't stand cilantro so...Added a little black pepper. ", "          I've made this recipe 4 different times now. Sometimes I add more serrano chiles because we like things hot! if I don't have lime juice I use lemon juice.", '          great recipe! i  was a touch short on cilantro but still had enough to make it work. ', '          I found the secret recipe for my favorite local Mexican restaurant! ', '          Super easy and very tasty! ', "          Easy tweaks to make this better. Blanch the tomatillos, onion, and Chili's for about 4-5 minutes first before for processing. when combining, use the juice of a full lime to taste."]

name: Avocado Mango Salsa
comments: ['          Very tasty salsa.  I did not make any changes to the recipe any brought it to a party.  I received many compliments.  Thanks for sharing.  I‚Äôll definitely make again ', '          This is my go to mango salsa! Only change I made was using a jalape√±o pepper. We served it with grilled snapper. It‚Äôs also delicious on tortilla chips ', '          Followed the recipe. Everyone loved it. ', '          Didn‚Äôt have limes, used lemon instead. Also used dried cilantro. Was an amazing accompaniment to mahi mahi with rice. Was AWESOME mixed with the rice. Tried it with tortilla chips too!  If it‚Äôs a hit with picky teenage daughter then it gets huge thumbs up from me!!!  This will be a staple in our house from now on and soooooo healthy!! ', '          I am in love with this salsa. My husband and I can‚Äôt have enough of it. ', '          Friends and family keep asking for the recipe! So easy and quick to prepare!  I make it a few hours before serving, cover in Saran Wrap, I leave in the fridge for all the flavours to marry!  Delicious ', '           Be sure your mango and avocado are both just barely ripe. You need a firm fruit or you get a slimy mess (That was my rookie mistake). That said, the recipe is excellent. I soaked the red onion to mellow the flavor and used serrano peppers [because they are in my garden ;) ] This is a go to side for Pork Carnitas. ', '          Nice / easy salsa. Everyone enjoyed it. ', '          Added some garlic powder and it was perfect ']

name: Filipino Avocado Milkshake
comments: ['          Great! ', "          being Latino i love avocado but my girlfriend being a pinay(i think thats what its called) loves it, so i decided to give it the old college try. i didn't have any milk on hand so i used condensed milk since that's what i had and it was amazing i love it! ", '          So very good! I scaled it down to 1 serving (1/2 avocado), and it was the perfect amount. I skipped the ice but added a small frozen banana and used the lime juice. It was thick, so I had to add more milk. Even then, it was still a little thick, but not icy-thick.....a nice creamy, smooth thick. Good way to use up avocados. Thanks for the recipe! ', "          Delicious. I used about half the sugar specified and they tasted great. But if you've got a sweet tooth... ", '          Me and my friend made it and it was really gross. We couldn‚Äôt even finish it. ', '          I has surgery on my stomach and had to be on a very soft diet for over a month.  This milkshake helped me keep my sanity.  I followed the directions but it was too thin, the reason for only 4 starts, so added an extra scoop of ice cream and it was perfect (5 starts).   I used it as my main drink for my protein and vitamin power. ', '          Super good. I have also used coconut milk in one I made and that is really good. Think maybe my favorite. ', "          I made an avocado milkshake today for the first time and it's amazing! ", '          I made some changes to the recipe and it was still very good. I used Splenda instead of sugar, forgot the lemon juice and I substituted cottage cheese for the ice cream (because I am counting calories). I bet if I make it with ice cream it will be even better! UPDATE: I just made this again with ice cream instead of the cottage cheese, soy milk, Splenda and lime juice and it is DELICIOUS!!  Thanks for the recipe. ']

name: Black Bean Avocado Salsa
comments: ['          So yummy ', '          Husband did the grocery shopping and forgot the red bell pepper so I substituted with cucumber. He also unknowingly bought a red chili pepper instead of a jalapeno. All worked out. He loves his salsa and loved this recipe! ', '          Wonderful summer salad/salsa. Love that the lime juice keeps the avocados green! I once had a version made with black eyed peas called Cowboy caviar, but I lost the recipe. This is every bit as good, and the black, red, green and yellow colors look great together. ', '          Made with scallions instead of red onions.  Equally as good. ', '          I‚Äôve made this several times for get togethers and it is always a hit. The only change is cutting back on cilantro because of friends that aren‚Äôt fans.  This one is definitely a keeper! ', '          I‚Äôve been making this recipe for years and love it. We eat it as a side dish. Recipe is very forgiving if you prefer more or less of an ingredient. I go easy on the cilantro. ', '          Very refreshing and different from the usual, I know this will be one of my favorites ', '          Absolutely fantastic combination of fresh flavors. I used apple cider vinegar and also added some heat with a few shakes of bottled hot sauce. I could literally eat this with a spoon straight from the bowl. Takes a lot of time to cut up all those veggies, but totally worth it. Thanks for a great recipe! ', '          Excellent! The only thing that I did differently, was instead of red pepper(I had no peppers), was to chop a cucumber up instead. ']

name: Spinach Salad with Chicken, Avocado, and Goat Cheese
comments: ['          I loved this recipe. We did not use the dressing it called for as we served to to our very picky teen boy but he ate all of it and did not complain about avocado and tomato that he normally complains about!! Yay!! ', '          This was a great dinner salad.  I did substitute toasted sunflower seeds for the pine nuts.  And used crumbled Feta Cheese instead of goat cheese.   DELICIOUS!   Shared with my family and friends too.  :) ', '          It was delicious! This is without the dressing but I made the dressing on the side. That was delicious too! ', '          The dressing is very good which I made as stated.  It really makes it.  Unfortunately I didn‚Äôt have all of the other ingredients so made some substitutions, but still good.  I will make again. ', '          Excellent salad!  The pine nuts pair well with the avocado and the goat cheese enhances the flavor. ', "          I loved it! I did 'customize' it a bit, tho. I had some leftover grilled salmon which I used in lieu of chicken - I've always liked salmon & spinach together. I tossed in a few slices of red onion, a bit of fresh dill, & added probably 1/2 tsp sugar to the dressing, for a more 'sweet & sour' profile. Would definitely make it again. ", '          Loved this recipe! I left out the pine nuts due to allergies and added some homemade garlic croutons for the crunch factor. Oh, and a few beets sliced too. Simply deliish!! ', '           This was so delicious! I used organic baby spinach! I marinated the chicken in a mixture of Teriyaki Sauce and Italian dressing for an hour before baking in the marinade! Even my meat-loving husband LOVED IT! ', '          Excellent. I didn‚Äôt have goat cheese so used feta. The dressing was delicious. Will Mae this again. ']

name: Best Guacamole
comments: ['          easy to make and always yummy. ', '          I made this and I don‚Äôt get why the oil is used at all or why lemons instead of limes. And no cilantro?! There are better recipes guacamole. ', '           This recipe is easy and yummy with the minimum ingredients. Next time I‚Äôll add cilantro but it‚Äôs great without. ', "          I used just under 1 tbsp of lemon juice as I didn't have a lemon. (not sure how much juice half a lemon renders)", '          I added tomatoes, small piece of garlic chopped up, a little jalape√±o pepper, and dried cilantro since I didn‚Äôt have fresh everything else I kept the way it was and it is delicious ', '           Amazing! ', '          Not bad but I will add half the onion next time and will try using a white onion instead of yellow. ', '          Light &tasty! ', '          Very quick and easy to prepare. Perfect for last minute condiment. More simple guac than I am used to but still very tasty and worked well with my tacos and fajitas. Will most assuredly use again. ']

name: Avocado Quick Bread
comments: ['          This was delicious.  Cut recipe in half and made 1 loaf.  To cut 3 eggs in half, I scrambled 2 eggs and used 3/4 of them.  I used 1 avocado. ', '          Good recipe added layer of batter then laid in some dark chocolate.Great with orange marmalade on it!May add banana to the mix next go around and tomorrow will do muffins. We were given 6 bags of avocados! ', "          What  delicious bread! I made it mostly according to the original recipe - the only changes I made were to bake it in a Bundt pan instead of two loaves,  and I didn't have any buttermilk so I did like a couple of previous commenters and used 1/2 cup of sour cream and a 1/4 cup of milk instead. I also used dried cranberries instead of raisins.  It was very moist and tasty and I will definitely make it again. Oh, and my bread was not at all green, but I was quite content with that. ", "          This was awesome and delicious!  Made during COVID-19 while trying to use up too many avocados that I bought.  Didn't have quite enough avocado, so used mashed bananas to make up for them.  Used half regular flour and half whole wheat.  Made one loaf and six large muffins.  Loaf took a full hour and I think would have burned had I not covered with aluminum foil after 40 minutes.  Liked muffins a little more because they didn't cook as long.  Shared with neighborhood kids, my daughter's friends, and they loved it!  Will definitely make again. ", '          This bread was easy, quick, cheesy, and delicious.  I added only 1/4 tsp cayenne instead of 1/2 tsp.  Everything else was the same.  Will definitely make again ', '          WOW, so moist and dense!', '          Great!  Very moist.  Fooled everyone; thought it was banana bread! ', '          Great!  Everyone loved it!  I didn‚Äôt make any changes to the recipe. ', '          After my alterations I loved this recipe. But before my adjustments it was appalling. The sugar content was so high that it was more dessert than anything else. It was rather nauseating to eat and I had to throw it out. The next time, I cut the sugar down to 1 1/3 cups and it was still super sweet, so I then added a grated carrot and some ginger. My husband is the pickiest eater I know and completely loathes avocado. I think I‚Äôll try to tweak this recipe again to see if I can turn it into a healthy bread. But as it was, after my changes my husband couldn‚Äôt stop raving about the bread and has said it‚Äôs his favorite bread I‚Äôve ever made. Overall, I‚Äôd say this recipe was a fantastic starting point, but that the recipe itself fell short. ']

name: Chicken Stuffed Baked Avocados
comments: ['          This was a good easy recipe. I used canned chicken, and it was still pretty good. It did make it more like a dip though. I added pickled jalapenos after baking only because my family likes them. Thanks for the recipe. ', "          I was really surprised how good this was. Warm avocado doesn't sound tasty at all but it came out creamy and very flavorful. I will be making this again and again. I made a casserole out of mine, used rotisserie chicken but didn't stuff the avocado skins. Other than that I followed the recipe just as it is. Leftovers the next day were still bright green and even better tasting. ", '          Fantastic.. you can also stuff with other things.. crab meat.. lobster meat.. if you like spicy a little cayenne pepper ', "          Just loved this recipe! I did add an jalapeno, cilantro, cumin and Cotija cheese. I had a nice amount left over so I stuffed it into mini peppers and baked them a little longer than the Avocados. Next time I'll remove more of the avocado pulp. I will make these again, so good!!! ", '          Used crab. Very good! ', "          I very much enjoyed this recipe paired with a nice quiche.  I wouldn't change anything with this recipe. ", '          I\'ve made this recipe 3-4 times and we simply love it! One key that I\'ve found is to make sure that you scoop out enough of the avocado flesh so that the flavors balance correctly - leaving too much in the shell causes it to lean more heavily towards "avocado". (Unless that\'s your thing, then go for it!)', '           Very Yummy and quickly made after work. ', '          This was delicious! Even with low fat cream cheese, very yummy. ']

name: Mexican Pizza I
comments: ['          Mmmmmmm. Like toastadas, but with melted cheese ', "          It didn't taste good ", "           I think, first and foremost, that people who alter the original without trying it first as presented are just wrong.  That being said, it's a wonderful recipe with a ton of variables that could be adapted to tailor it to you or your families needs.  But jeez people...rate the recipe...not your version. ", '          I used 2 lbs of ground beef.  Used 10 small tortillas. If use flour tortillas would need 2 cans of beans. Used more cheese ', '          I made this exactly as the directions instructed.  The recipe is a hit!  I will definitely make it again. ', '           Quick and easy very tasty ', '          These are delicious! I see that I should have doubled the recipe, though, for my family of 5. These were gobbled up before they even had time to cool. ', '          It was so tasty and easy to make.  It is a new family favorite. ', "          Tasty  but I don't like the hard tortillas; makes it very difficult to cut, bite or chew through. Not worth the trouble of cooking the tortillas.  Soft wraps are much easier to prepare, serve and eat. "]

name: Carne Asada Tacos
comments: ["           Really enjoyed this recipe! I've been looking for some more traditional mexican style carne asada tacos and this was it. Brings back great memories of serving in Mexico. Used some salsa from the store, but still came out really nicely. I would reccomend. ", '           It was delish! My family added shredded cheddar to our‚Äôs but with or without they were perfect! ', "          Family loved it and I was told 'this one is a keeper'. I was pleasantly surprised that my finicky daughter eight more tacos than us! She loved them. ", "          This was easy to make and was good. I used KC strip steak which made it very tender. I cut back on the peppers, but it could have used more. We prefer flour tortillas so we used those. I didn't understand why you would double the tortillas up so I didn't. I marinated for a couple of hours. I will make this again. ", '          Loved it! These are now my favorite tacos. ', "          I had to do a lot of substitution as it's the end of the month, and money and groceries are low. Good, but not as good as I'm sure they could have been - will try again when I have all the right ingredients! ", "          This dish was absolutely delicious!  The tomatillo sauce is one of the best sauces I've ever tasted.  I bought the meat already sliced thin making the dish that much quicker to make.  I can't wait to eat the leftovers! ", '          Absolutely PERFECT! I LOVED the salsa recipe. Not too spicy, not too mild ', '          Made this  with 1/2 tsp of red pepper and 1 large chopped Jalapeno .  It was so good the guests I served it to asked for the recipe. ']

name: Smoked Salmon Sushi Roll
comments: ["           I've add some cream cheese. The best combination :) ", '          It was great but one mistake i made was not wrapping it the write way but i learned.I will definitely  make it again. ', '          Another reviewer said to mix 2 tsp of brown sugar into the vinegar and warm it so the sugar melts before adding to the rice, I did this and was very happy with the result, but next time I would double the sugar.  ', "          I've been making sushi from this recipe for about 3 years now. I've tried many variations of ingredients. It is an art no doubt. Patience is indeed needed but quickness is a necessity. I also make a teriyaki-honey sauce for dipping. YUM! ", '          Loved it and substituted just about everything. Had only arborio rice, but prepped and cooked it as per these directions including a 4-5 hour soak and a few drains. I had about 4oz of leftover grilled salmon (not enough to feed our family of 4) so I tried this recipe. Glad I did. I spread the rice as thinly as possible, yet covering most of the nori surface except the top 1/2", then sprinkled some ground ginger over the rice. On half of the rolls, I used about 1T guacamole and some wasabi. On the other half I used wasabi & capers that I squished between my fingers before dotting onto the rice, about 10 capers per sheet. Added the salmon, wet the top of the nori and rolled them up with a bamboo sushi roller. The sharp meat knife I used, sliced through them perfectly! Delicious. THanks for the recipe. ', '          Very easy and tasty recipe, great as an appetizer or even as dinner if you make more of them (I find about 6-8 per diner is a good number). One word of caution: spring for good sushi-grade nori, available at most Asian groceries. The cheaper stuff has a slightly sealike taste that, combined with the smoked salmon, makes the finished roll way too fishy. ', "          I think once I get the hang of rolling these I'll be able to give it a 5-star rating! I did alright, but there's a lot of room for improvement! My sushi-loving family loved them! ", '          awesome recipe for beginners, I personally thought it could use more flavor, but I enjoyed them along with my husband and 2 year old. ', '          The amount of rice vinegar was good, but I found the need to add some sugar to cut the acidity of the rice.  Otherwise, it is an excellent recipe.  As a note, you will want a VERY sharp knife to cut the sushi into individual pieces. ']

name: Avocado Deviled Eggs
comments: ["          Wow, we loved this recipe. Made as written except for the bacon, as I didn't have any. So tasty and creamy! Will be making this again and adding it to my recipe collection. ", "          I didn't use the peppers and I used bacon in the mix and for the topper.  Delicious! ", '          No to the bacon. Not necessary to add more than mayonnaise and a bit of onion. A lot of recipes are like the more ingredients, the better. Not true. ', '           I only made from three hard boiled eggs, cut the recipe in half. Very delicious! I plan on making these again. ', '          OMG! Love this recipe. I will be renaming it "Millenial Deviled Eggs" because we LOVE avocados. This is the first dish I made for Thanksgiving this year. I was also excited to break out my piping bag and tip for the filling. Some advice: Make sure your piping tip is big enough for the bacon to slide thru. Oops. Anyway, I love the creaminess and they\'re beautiful too. Thanks! ', "          Amazing.  I omitted the hot sauce as I didn't have any on hand and didn't buy any.  Just the right amount of heat.  I also only put jalapenos on half for those that don't enjoy spicy.  This are definitely my go to deviled eggs going forward. ", '          I took these to a party and whereas I thought the jalapeno was an exciting new flavor, it turned off most folks.  Those that ate them, took the jalapenos off. ', '          Made these for Christmas last year and they were a big hit. I‚Äôd never used avocado before so they didn‚Äôt come out like I wanted but everyone loved them. Forgot to take pictures ?? ', '          Maybe I did something wrong but to me these weren‚Äôt that great. Seemed a little runny and not super flavorful. I followed the recipe pretty closely except I added some additional hot pepper flakes. Even w that it was a little bland. I think there is too much mayo as the recipe is written. I read others skipped the mayo and added more avocado, and I would do that next time if I were to make this again. I‚Äôd still use a little mayo but just a little. Also, I served these right away so maybe they firm up more if refrigerated. Regardless, I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the flavor or consistency. ']

name: Mexican Chicken and Rice Soup (Sopa de Pollo y Arroz)
comments: ["          It was extremely good!  I will add cumin next time but that's about my only change.  Loved it,! ", '          My husband and I loved this soup! ', '           Made this for my family and they loved it. I wanted more vegetables in it so I added chayote squash and yellow summer squash. For the toppings in addition to the recipe I used fresh Cilantro, dried oregano, fresh onions and Valentina hot sauce. Super good and very healthy soup. ', '          Delicious! ', '          Very tasty and nice change from regular turkey soup after Christmas.  I used a lot of chili pepper flakes and enjoyed the cilantro and lime flavours. ']

name: Easy Arugula Salad
comments: ['          Super easy, super fast, and super good! ', '          One of my favourite salads ', '          So easy and convinced my arugula hating husband of this leafy greens worth! ', '          Went for a March walk in the garden and was surprised to find a patch of arugula growing. The dressing was a perfect compliment for the peppery green. I didn‚Äôt have pine nuts so I used some sugared almonds. Added the needed crunch. Hope more people find this excellent recipe. Thanks! ', "          Very good. I added a little red onion for flavor. We didn't have fresh Parmesan cheese so I had to use the grated, which made the salad a bit dry. I doubled up on the rice vinegar and olive oil and it was perfect. Would make again! ", "          I didn't have parmesian so I used goat cheese which is creamy. I broke it into chunks and when I tossed the salad it made a creamy dressing with some chunks of cheese. I also used grape tomatoes that I roasted the day before. It was so yummy that I made it again the next day. My husband who normally does not like arugula loved this salad! ", '          This is a salad that I will add to our meals regularly. So yummy and so easy! ', '          Very easy and good. I did not use the capers and I used shaved parmesan cheese. ', '          I enjoyed it a lot.. It is nice and refreshing.. ']

name: California Roll Sushi
comments: ['          it was good and it was fun to make ', '          Recipe called to cook rice in a pan , which burned all of the rice at the bottom, overall not amazing ', '          So So SoSo AMAZING. HAVE TO TRY IT!!!! ', '          I have zero experience in cooking and I made sushi following these clear instructions. To my surprise, my kids loved these experimental sushi and asked for more.', '          excellent! ', '           This is so good but you have to use the right knife and I use 1/4 cups of mayonnaise with 3 batches ', "          The exact taste of a sushi restaurant is there. Very difficult to roll without a bamboo roller, so the form wasn't quite right. ", '          Not bad. Won‚Äôt use mayo next time. And I‚Äôd use 1 thick cucumber strip rather than a few thin. ', "          I would have given it a 5 but it was my first time and I'm sure I can do better. "]

name: Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita
comments: ["          I love this recipe and have made it several times to rave reviews from family and friends.  The only modification I'd recommend is to let the shrimp sit for several hours in the lime juice or just use cooked shrimp (which doesn't seem to affect the results).  The first time I made it as written, the shrimp was a bit raw. Also, if you like things a little spicy like me, adding minced garlic and chopped jalapeno to taste works well. ", '          Loved it! Gone in no time! Cant wait to make it again!!!! ', '          Excellent!  Added the Worchestershire sauce, salt and pepper and let it cook overnight. I added a dash of cumin too, just because. ', '           Have made this twice. I use wild caught shrimp already cooked and still marinate in lime juice for the stated amount of time or over night. Family like spicy, so I tweak the sauce; 2Tbs Ketchup, 2Tbs Worcestershire, 1Tbs Sriracha, 2Tbs Tapat√≠o & 1Tbs liet soy sauce (yeah, yeah). I also double the Romas and use a whole head of Cilantro. Must use fresh ground pepper and either sea salt or fresh ground pink himalayan. Awesome! ', "          My first time eating this and it was delicious!  I didn't know you could cook shrimp in fresh lime juice, so I learned something new too.  My son and daughter in law were here, their Hispanic friends make this all the time and they said this recipe stacks up along side the best.  We ate too much and then had dinner and birthday cake with ice cream.  Perfect family Sunday! ", '           Didn‚Äôt add the avocado on this picture. I still had it marinating but so far it taste delicious. Added jalape√±os for a little kick. Tomorrow for lunch I will add some of the crab meat that I have.  I appreciate the recipe! ', '           The taste is great, but the shrimp was in the lime juice too long and "overcooked". Maybe 30 mins would have been better. My only change was using green onions instead of regular ones because I was out and adding orange peppers. ', '          Easy to make!! I‚Äôve made this several times and each time it‚Äôs a crowd pleaser. I highly recommend ', '          Easy and very flavorful ceviche. I rough chopped already cooked shrimp and Persian cucumbers.  I also added mango for an interesting sweet note and Yuzu Hot Sauce for a little more kick and citrus notes.   I would usually use a cocktail sauce for more kick but I made the sauce with ketchup per the recipe and I found I liked the bit of sweetness it added as it married well  with the mango .  It was a big hit at my event. ']

name: Avocado Toast (Vegan)
comments: ['          Easy to make.  Delicious breakfast with juice/fruit & coffee. ', '          So simple, quick and fresh,  my new go-to recipe! ', '          I used one fresh garlic clove rather than use powdered, did not use onion salt, used french bread as no multigrain on hand.  Good. ', '          This avocado toast recipe was very quick and easy to make. The only change I made was instead of using black pepper. I used red pepper for a little more kick. It was absolutely delicious definitely will make it again. ', '          DEATH BY LEMON!!  I added the juice of half of lemon as instructed and it was not edible.  The next time I made this I used only a teaspoon of lemon juice and was excellent! ', '          Delicious on protein bread/toast! ', '          easy, delish!  next time a little less lemonthank you ', '          I made with out the parsley add 1/2 dised Italian tomatoes spooned out seeds, and 1/4 tsp salt. This recipe is so good all my guest loved it I had as a dip at a party and it was gone right away. ', '          Good flavor but reduced seasonings due to small size of avocados. Fantastic with an egg on top! ']

name: Quesadillas I
comments: ["          Worked out well enough, but you might have to increase cooking time to get a nice crispy outside. There's lots of flexibility with this recipe, too. You can change the filling, but use this recipe as a guide to make sure you aren't under- or overfilling your quesadillas. This is a good starting point for someone who hasn't made them before. ", "           Making quesadillas in a frying pan is my preferred way to make. I spray the pan with just a little cooking spray. If using larger flour tortillas, fold them in half and place two in the pan, and they are easier to flip. I usually use Mexican blend cheese, but I love using half mozzarella and half cheddar. The submitter's idea of putting in a dash of hot sauce inside the tortilla is great. I prefer to put olives, salsa and avocado on the side. ", '          used mexican mix cheese ', '          Made  a few just mozz, few mixed mozz & mexican blend, few mozz, mex & swiss. Mine had some olives, hubbys didnt. The just mozz ones i made with tuscan seasoning and roasted peppers to go with pasta. No matter how you make them...delicious! ', '          just had this for lunch. If you run out of the mottzarello cheese your can use a different kind. Also good idea to have everything ready to go as it cooks up quickly. Will diffently will try again ', '          Mmmm loved the avocado in the quesadilla. Made to go as a side to taco soup/chili. ', "          I've made this with flour wheat tortillas and with the corn tortillas - they both were great! The wheat tortillas were a little larger which made it easier to fill and handle in the hot pan. I used pepper jack and cheddar cheese. Thanks for posting this delicious recipe Cody. ", '          I added some hummus on the tortilla- delicious! ', '          My family has made a slight variation of this recipe for years. The main variation we do is that we add a very shallow coating of vegatable oil to the pan before placing the tortilla in it, and fry the tortilla until it is slightly crisp on both sides. It makes for a crunchier quesadilla, and when cut into slices, it makes a great appetizer or movie/game snack. Good basic recipe, thanks! ']

name: Avocado Toast with Egg
comments: ['          This is easy, healthy, and quickly made.  I served it with Chipotle fire roasted salsa, just the right touch. ', '          This was so good and so easy to make. I will definitely be making this again. I am stuffed. ', '          Made this for my wife and I for a quick lunch.  We used the balsamic as a substitute for lemon juice recommendation and we thought it was quite good. ', '          this was a perfect after run breakfast and filled me up. ', '          really good ', "           I did have to substitute lime juice for the lemon juice because I forgot to get lemon juice at thr store yesterday and it's too early to get there right now. But, the lime juice didn't make an awful tasting substitution. This toast is a great way to get all my morning nutrients in. ", '           This was so good! It really hit the spot this morning! ', '          Made this for my husband who needs to avoid salt right now. It was good but salt definitely kicks it up a notch. For him, I omitted salt and added a bit of onion powder and minced garlic (the kind that is jarred in water) for a fully sodium-free version. (Minus what was in the bread, of course) He loved it. Thank you so much! ', "          Just like other reviewers have said, sometimes simple is best. This was easy, fast and delicious. We didn't change a thing and will definitely make it again! "]

name: Kale, Quinoa, and Avocado Salad with Lemon Dijon Vinaigrette
comments: ['          I added fresh jalapeno finely chopped and Grape tomatoes cut in quarters.  I omitted the red bell pepper. ', "          This salad is SOOOO yummy.  I didn't think I'd like it because of the quinoa but it's so tasty and holds up in the fridge! ", '          Absolutely loved it! ', '          This is a great recipe! I removed the bell peppers and used low-fat Balsamic Vignagrette salad dressing. Yummy! ', "           I love this salad and so does everyone else who has tasted it.  We were going to have friends over and they wanted to delay due to the need to eat healthy. I said I have some delicious healthy recipes. Usually I serve this with salmon steaks but tonight I served it with baked yams.For four of us I doubled the recipe and had a little left over.I also really enjoy a balsamic glaze drizzled over this!  It's delicious on its own but the balsamic glaze kicks it up a notch!  In the attached photo, I had not yet added the feta cheese. . . That's important!  ;-) ", '          Yum! I use some homemade fermented or pickled red onions in place of fresh cut and throw in diced chicken, ham or egg for some added protein. ', "           I keep going back to this one, it's so good!! ", '          Stephanie you went over and beyond delicious.  I‚Äôm always trying to find healthy recipes (without sacrificing taste) for my fitness group I teach.  This was a hit.  Thank you, next time I have to double the recipe.  I usually make healthy dishes once a month as a little treat after class and serve them in the teeny, tiny tasting bowls, but this time, they looked at me like I was crazy...so it was requested for our next treat as a full lunch.  Isn‚Äôt that some nerve??. ', '          I had this as late lunch, since am trying to loose weight and my daughter loved it. I omitted the cheese and was still delicious ']

name: Awesome Turkey Sandwich
comments: ['          Excellent  choice ! ', "          This is an awesome sandwich, great for lunch, or a lazy evening when cooking isn't an option. One of my favorite healthy choices. ", '          Delicious. I made a few changes but all delicious. My boyfriend and I loved it! ', '          These sandwiches are really good.  Depends a lot on the quality of the guacamole. ', "           It was ok  I've had better sandwiches I tweeted the recipe a little bit. I used Mexican four cheeses iceberg lettuce mayo organic mustard and tomatoes I didn't  have all the ingredients and i used white bread. ", '          Best sandwich ever ', '          I thought this tasted pretty good. I had all the ingredients but the sprouts. Instead of guacamole I just used sliced avacado. I also used a different low fat cheese and lite mayo. I thought the mustard amount was excessive and cut that in half. It made for a filling sandwich for lunch today. ', '          This was a pretty good sandwich, a lot different than usually make. I didnt have bean sprouts, but sure wish I did. ', '          This definitely is an "Awesome Turkey Sandwich"! I used whole grain bread and Hellman\'s light mayo. I left out the bean sprouts and opted for some smoked bacon instead. I used Swiss cheese vs. Monterey Jack and OMG - this was really good! Perfect for lunch with a dill pickle on the side... ']

name: Grilled Avocados
comments: ['          Game changing! ', "          Good on the grill. The avocados I had didn't have a lot of flavor. Next time I will try the Hass  Avocados. I favored them with Old Bay Spice & Garlic salt. ", '          These were ok. I made them exactly as written.  A bit bland but a great idea on how to grill avocados! Next time I may add a pinch of salt and some fresh lime juice. ', '          Not a fan of spicy, I used a Chipotle Lime seasoning made by Wildtree. It was great! Thanks for the simple and delicious idea! ', '          We found these fairly bland, but I like the basis.   When I try again, I will slice, and season the slices individually to get a bit more flavor.   I think Cajun would be good on this. ', '           Very good! All it needed was a sprinkling of sea salt at the end...tasty! I would make these again. Thanks for sharing. :) ']

name: Taco Salad III
comments: ['          Love this recipe.  I make it regularly and often tweak it depending on what I have on hand.  I\'ve also used the recipe with some added ingredients as a "build your own" taco salad bar when I have a few guests at lunch.  I always put out sour cream, black olives and diced green chilies for those who like a little "fire".  Always a success.  For just my small family, I use the recipe as printed but cut it in half.  Great summer meal. ', "          This is a great recipe.   Easy and tasty.   The Catalina Salad dressing is great--and so easy to add! A keeper I've done for many years. ", '          Everyone loved this!  I used ground turkey instead of beef, omitted the kidney beans, used regular Doritos and Ranch dressing instead of Catalina. ', '           My family loved this salad!!  It will be a go to for a refreshing, quick dinner.  I did not put onions in mine (not a fan), no kidney beans with avocado on the side.  Other than that I made it to recipe. ', '          Turned out great! Added cooked corn, used black beans instead of pinto beans and used Cathy‚Äôs suggestion for modifying the dressing (mixed together Catalina dressing, sour cream, a bit of taco seasoning and Hidden Valley Ranch dressing mix). Will definitely make this again! ', '          Very good! Didn‚Äôt use chips and opted for a tortilla bowl and instead of the Catalina dressing, I mixed some taco sauce with ranch dressing and it was ', '          It was great with home made Catalina salad dressing ', "          Very good and easy salad to prepare. Enjoyed by everyone at luncheon. Will use iceberg next time--I didn't have anything but romaine and thought it would work. Lesson learned. ", '          mmmmm ']

name: Vegetarian Tortilla Soup
comments: ['          OK...  I made this for the first time tonight, and followed the recipe exactly.  Some comments follow:1.  It is a good tasting soup, but not great.  Strong tomato taste.2.  Canned chopped peppers...?  There is no such thing in my local store.  There are 50 varieties of whole, sliced and diced peppers.  I used diced.3.  When I opened the Pepper and Onion Stir Fry Mix, I realized it is just red, green and yellow bell peppers with onion.  This soup would undoubtedly be better with fresh ingredients.  The frozen ingredients turn out too soft.4.  The Avocado is essential and adds significantly to the taste.  Do not skip this.5.  There are no tortilla strips suitable for this soup at my grocery.  I used plain and blue-corn triangle chips as a substitute.  Not great.6.  The cheese is optional - skip it.I may make this soup again, but I would use fresh ingredients and probably add some fresh celery, cut back on the ground cumin, and may skip the tortilla chips. ', '           Delicious vegan soup or good with chicken broth. We add 1/2 c rice and 2-4 c black beans. ', '          I have always questioned whether 3 Tablespoons of cumin is correct.  A NYT recipe calls for only 1 1/2 teaspoons of chili powder.  I have wondered if the correct amount of cumin is 3 teaspoons rather than Tablespoons.  I always use fresh red, yellow and orange peppers, onion, garlic and often fresh jalape√±o and add frozen corn, as well.  I plan on experimenting with different spices like coriander in the future. ', '          Delicious! I used 2 cans of green chilies instead of 3 and added a can of beans. If you want to add protein, chicken makes it even better! ', '           So good!!!! ', "          I thought it was great! My husband and son didn't care for it because there were no dead animals in it. I only had 1 can of green chiles so I threw in 3 fresh jalapeno peppers. That probably made it more spicy, but I thought it was perfect ", '           Very filling! And very tasty! I added black beans and topped it off with lime tortilla chips, avocado, a dollop of sour cream, and shredded cheddar... then squeezed a little lime juice on top. So very good! My youngest son refilled his bowl twice! ', '          I substituted chicken broth for vegetable broth. Incredible depth of flavor!  And super easy to make. I made it a day ahead to let the flavors develop and meld. Crowd favorite! ', '          This has been a favorite of ours since like 2006 or so.
